column1: full, straight, threatening, squeezed out to the leg side, they scramble a hasty run, and Imam-ul-Haq is down and injured after tangling with Tyrone Kane, and clattering his head on the keeper's hip!
three slips and a gully, and that's a peach from Murtagh, a high action, a bit of shape across the left-hander and through to the keeper on a tight line
very full, very straight, Imam puts his bat behind the line to press the ball back down the pitch
a well-judged leave, passing over the top of off stump, as Imam plays this on on length. Encouraging carry, but that will keep the slips on their toes
another fine delivery, nipping away on a full length and past the edge once more
full and accurate once more, plopped onto a good length just outside off, and cautiously poked back to the bowler. Now that's how to settle into your Test career as a bowler
on the pads and tucked around the corner
a cloud-scraping action, dropped onto a full length, aping Murtagh's approach and drawing a cautious block
leaping bounce from a good length, and Imam shoulders arms once more
on the back foot, pushed back down the wicket
a big stride down the wicket, covering the angle across the left-hander and leaving well alone
no stroke this time
good nip back into the right-hander! Outside off, hits the seam and clatters into the midriff. Squawks all round
full once more, very steady line and length, with a hint of shape. Demanding respect
tapped into the off side, and that's a sharp single - the type that caused Imam his bother in the first over. But he's safely home this time
beaten outside off, a cracking delivery, but O'Brien has shied at the stumps and is appealing for the run-out! Nope, that's safe. But sharp thinking from the keeper
back of a length, nipping back into the left-hander, punched off the back foot to short cover
very full, very tight, very carefully placed back down the pitch with a full face of the bat. This is dogged stuff from Ireland, nothing for Pakistan to work with just yet
through to the keeper, no stroke offered. Good carry from Rankin's lanky frame
wider line, no stroke needed here
very full, into the toes of the right-hander, clipped to the leg side
tucked off the pads, to the leg side
outside off, and no stroke once more
back of a length, Azhar hops deep into his crease, looks to push a quick single to midwicket, but Imam wants nothing to do with it! Safely aborts in the end, but signs of indecision
clipped off the legs, to short midwicket
fuller and loopier, drawing a slightly more aggressive push-drive, but gathered in the followthrough with menacing intent

the first boundary of the day! The first runs scored by Imam, and the first four conceded in Irish Test history, and it is utterly sumptuous. Down on one knee, a flogging flash of the blade, and clean through the covers!
back of a length, straighter line this time and duly respected
on the hips, tucked to backward square
squeezed into the cordon, all along the ground, well intercepted with a dive. Five overs gone and it's a cat-and-mouse contest out there
full once more, squeezed to backward square off an inside-edge, and Rankin concedes his first runs in his (Ireland) Test career
awkward length! This one climbs from a very full length, and squirts off the splice into the gully. Well bowled
outside off, no stroke this time
tucked off the pads, out to the leg side
full, straight, blocked

short and sharp! Didn't get up much but that was very well directed and Imam limboed inside the line with the aplomb of a left-handed Robin Smith. And leaves don't attract much higher praise than that
full again, angling towards a still-packed cordon. Blocked back down the pitch
outside off, through to the keeper again
through to the keeper
outside off, shaping away from the right-hander, he'll keep plugging away there all day
back of a length, and an improvised forcing shot through midwicket. Well placed in the end, and a long chase for mid-on
left alone on a wide line once more
angling into the left-hander, pushed back to the bowler
on the back foot to block another leaping delivery
nudged to the leg side, a good tumbling stop at square leg
inside-edged defence down to backward square leg
soft hands into the off side

Rankin strikes! Ireland have their first Test wicket! Hugely deserved breakthrough, another tight line, leaping delivery, kisses the splice with a bit of nip off the deck and lobs invitingly into the hands of second slip. Will Porterfield makes no mistake, and Malahide is jubilant!

massive appeal, and Ireland have two in two! And Murtagh has his maiden wicket too! Incredible scenes, another full length, pitched on middle-and-off, straightened off the deck and would have knocked back the off stump. Imam was only halfway into his forward stride when he was pinned on the kneeroll. Scenes!
the team hat-trick ball causes yet more anxiety, and a direct hit would have been out! Pushed to cover, the non-striker was dawdling down the pitch, and was nearly done like a kipper!
forward in solid defence
Ireland are really pumped now! This one takes the edge once more, a bit of a hard-handed push outside the line, and fourth slip pounces like a kitten on a ball of wool to intercept
more oohs and aahs as this one climbs through to the keeper as well
full forward and blocked back down the pitch. Lively times!
starts with an over-step, but a bustling pace on off stump nonetheless
big nip off the seam as Shafiq leaves alone outside off
good tight line, no stroke once more, but hustling through to the keeper
leaping off the deck, Shafiq hauls his gloves out of harm's way
this is aggressive and booming swing from Kane so far. A flatter trajectory than Rankin was serving up (understandably!) but nipping all over the shop
more lateral nip for Kane, and more oohs of appreciation
back of a length, tighter line, tapped to cover, looking for the single but nothing doing
beats the outside edge once more, that was excruciatingly full and so tight to the bat
another fine delivery, grazing through to the keeper on a lovely tight line
left alone on a good length outside off, less jeopardy in that stroke
full once more, striding down the pitch to defend into the off side
well left, back of a length, and Sohail reads the movement into the body well as he keeps his hands high
blocked to point
more hooping away-swing but no shot offered
tight to off stump this time, jabbed to cover with firm hands
through to the keeper again, no stroke offered
passes the outside edge as Shafiq is lured into an injudicious prod
full and aggressive, and tapped to the off side
outside off, no stroke offered. No pace in that delivery from the dogged Murtagh, but no width either
middle and leg line, jabbed off the pads to the leg side
well bowled once more, curling past the outside edge as Shafiq struggles to get fully forward to the delivery
outside off, that was a bit of a wide half-volley to be frank, but Pakistan are in survival mode for the moment, so discretion is the better part of valour
poked firmly down into the crease for short leg to snaffle
looped up and drilled down the ground, not quite timed but finds the gap behind the bowler
on the pads, very full once more, tucked to the leg side
punched firmly down the ground, that was quality and compact, and clean through long-off
guided to the off side with firm hands and a straight blade
big nip across the left-hander, a tumbling take from O'Brien behind the stumps
through to the keeper once more
outside off once again, no stroke offered. And that, I presume, will be drinks
just short of a good length outside off, left alone, nice carry to the keeper
pushed into the pads
on off stump, back of a length, defended to the covers
a touch fuller, a demanding length, Shafiq makes himself get forward as he defends to the covers
nicely bowled, Shafiq gets a little squared up as he aims to work a length delivery into the leg side and a leading edge goes towards the covers
full outside off, left alone
short of a length, angled across outside off, dies somewhat as it reaches the keeper
fuller, at off stump, met with a solid cover drive as he gets onto the front foot and finds the gap through cover
in the air! Wide of the slips. Full, wide outside off, Shafiq can't resist having a drive, a long way away from his body and the edge skews through the gully area to third man
full outside off, a bustling action from Kane, defended to the covers
short of a length outside off, punched from the back foot into the covers and Kevin O'Brien dives from point to intercept
pushed across wide outside off, doesn't need to play, reaches Niall on the second bounce
nips back from a good length, beats the inside edge and takes him high on the pad
full outside off, left alone, Niall takes this one on the rise
left alone outside off
short of a length, slips down the leg side, Shafiq not a million miles from getting a tickle on that
full at the stumps, he closes the face and tucks it behind square on the leg side
full outside off to the left hander, allows it harmlessly to the keeper
full outside off, left alone, some movement away from the batsman
and again, keeps it outside off, Kane a skiddier type of bowler and he's found some movement
touch fuller and closer to off stump, he gets forward and defends to point
straighter, very full, defended back to the bowler
wider outside off, he doesn't play
another one through to the keeper, more bounce this time, Niall moves across towards first slip to gather
full outside off, left alone
down the leg side, short of a length, Haris gets across his stumps but can't flick it away
over adjusts his line a little too much, short and wide outside off, doesn't post a danger
that's more like it, on off stump, short of a good length, slides off a thickish outside edge along the ground through gully
left alone outside off
gets forward and pushes a full delivery through the covers
not a bad start, full and straight, hint of late swing, dug out to the leg side
sprays this one very wide outside off, and Nigel Llong calls it a wide
slashed over the slips, went after a delivery with a hint of width, aiming a square cut, takes a thick top edge and flies over the cordon
onto the front foot and driven to mid-off where Rankin does well to cut it off
full, wide, left alone
that's well bowled, late movement which squares up Shafiq as he defends towards backward point
full, angled into the pads, flicked to long leg
short, wide and hammered! Shafiq latches onto that with power. Crunches a square drive which bursts through the hands of point
fuller, wide outside off, left alone
well bowled! That's the perfect spot, full and just outside off, drawing him forward and late movement beats the outside edge
gets a stride forward and then lifts the bat out of the line. This one was a little wider
too wide this time, carries through low to the keeper
a little closer to off stump but he's again able to watch this one go through
back of a length outside off, hint of shape back at the left hander but wide enough to leave
on off stump, good length, defended to cover
gets across onto off stump and defends back to the bowler
this fuller, touch of late swing as it straightens on Haris, met with a full face and plays to mid-off
forces this one through the leg side, taken from around off stump, the face closes and it runs through midwicket
shorter, outside off, punched square from the back foot and finds point
full outside off, onto the front foot and pushes to the covers for a quick single...been some dodgy running today, but that was well-judged
full at middle and leg, pushed firmly back to Kane
full at off stump, played to mid-off
on the pads and that's nicely timed through the leg side, a flick of the wrists gets it wide of square leg
short of a length at off stump, defended solidly to the off side
opens the face and steers a back-of-a-length delivery through the covers...things just starting to look a little easier for the batsmen
angled into the pads, picks out square leg
full at off stump, defended into the leg side, the bat face twists
tucks a straight delivery down to long leg
full, wide outside off, left alone
reasonably gentle pace, full outside off, through to the keeper with a hint of wobble
shorter of length, he doesn't offer a shot
full outside off, left alone
well bowled! This jumps from a good length, Shafiq is playing forward, the ball takes the splice of the bat and he whips the bottom hand off the bat
pushed into the pads, worked down to long leg
full at middle and leg, worked to midwicket
played into the leg side
very wide outside off, Niall O'Brien takes it almost in front of second slip
corrects his line, good length at off stump, defended to midwicket
outside off, left alone
on the pads and sweetly played through the leg side, excellent timing as he beats midwicket
back of a length at off stump, defended to point
angled very full across the left hander, late movement takes it further away
back on off stump, full length, defended
short outside leg stump, gets inside the line and tucks it towards long leg
over the wicket, full outside off, defended to cover
short of a length outside off, he opens the face into the backward point area and it's well cut off with a dive
poor delivery, full and fired down the leg side, O'Brien dives but can't glove it cleanly
down the leg side again, this time to the right hander, as the radar goes a little wrong
a shorter delivery outside off, he rocks back and square drives through point...brings up the fifty stand
short again, this time it doesn't cost him as Shafiq cuts to point. Not a great over from O'Brien
short of a length at off stump, played to mid-on
the bottom hand comes into play as he takes this from off stump to the leg side
zips across outside off, left alone
short of a length, middle and leg line, tries to tuck it into the leg side but goes back to the bowler
a bouncer, a rare one in this session, ducks underneath
so close! Almost the perfect end to the session, a short-of-a-length delivery with some late movement, Haris gets squared up and the outside edge flies just wide of gully
full length, right on the money, blocked back down the pitch
outside off, no stroke offered, tight line once more
full length, on the leg stump, popped up off the hip, out to the leg side
lovely bowling! A tantalising length, drawing the batsman forward and beating him off the pitch. Line, length and a hint of nibble. That'll do!
full once more, tucked to midwicket with a compact clip
very full once again, nudged to the leg side
slightly leg-sided, and pushed off the pads
well bowled! Very full, luring the drive, but dipped and nipped, through the air and past the edge. A flashing air shot from Sohail
tucked to the off side
leaping delivery outside off, through to the keeper once more
tucked off the pads, out to deep backward square.
standing tall on the back foot, blocking into the off side

edged and gone, and Thompson joins the debutant wickets list! Dangled outside off, a loose poke on the back foot from Sohail, hands away from the body, and Porterfield reaches forward at gully with calm hands to give Ireland the perfect lift in this session!
back foot, and blocked
drawn forward and pushed to short cover
loopy full length, right up to the toes, poked to the bowler
very full once more, dipping into the toes, and blocked back up the pitch
tapped to the off side, nice soft hands
angled into the pads, clipped calmly behind square
on the back foot, dead-batted down into the crease
punched hard off the back foot, into the off side
short and wide, and flogged through backward point with a dismissive clip of the wrists. Have some of that
tapped to the off side
leaning forward in defence
onto the front foot and poked to the off side once more
outside off, and no stroke offered
very full, very straight,  very compactly driven to mid-on
squared up on the back foot but just short of fourth slip! Tight line, good lift off the seam

huge appeal! Murtagh beats a front-foot poke with late nip into the right-hander, but umpire Illingworth reckons he was struck just outside the line... no DRS, but that would probably have remained on-field either way. Yikes!
wider line, no stroke
leg-sided, flicks the pad, and gathered behind square. Lively times! No lbw appeal, but that wasn't un-adjacent...
pops off a good length, loops off the shoulder of the bat! But gully can only watch it sail over his head! Pakistan are living dangerously!
fully forward and blocked back down the pitch
forward, into the off side
outside off, climbing through to the keeper
very full, on the toes, clipped to the leg side
punched off the back foot, firmly through the covers. Top ball-striking, right on the top of the bounce
flipped to the leg side, gathered at backward square
forward and blocked to the leg side
well bowled again, bending off the deck and through to the keeper
tailing away from the right-hander, solid defence on the front foot
full and swinging, solid defence on the front foot
picked off the toes, down to backward square leg
another bouncing bomb to launch his spell, awkward lift off the deck and poked into the gully
too full and speared down the leg side, Babar biffs him off the toes through backward square
drilled off the back foot for back-to-back fours. Rankins over-adjusts and serves up a wide long-hop. Careful now...
much better third time lucky. Full, straight and threatening. Blocked French-cricket style back down the pitch
banged in short, down the leg-side. A one-day wide, but all fair game in this format
another shocker of a delivery, much fuller, way down the leg side this time. But again, it's a dot ball. Not the most rhythmic resumption from Big Boyd
outside off, through to the keeper
through to the keeper, no stroke offered
on the pads, tucked to the leg side
over-pitched, and a forcing push down the ground, half-stopped at mid-on, but he's looking in promising touch now
left alone with a big stride onto the front foot
keeps low on off stump, and well dug out with a late adjustment
on the leg stump, and worked to the fielder
nip off the seam, into the right hander who blocks uncomfortably on the back foot. Better from Rankin
left alone on length, and thuds into the thigh pad. Awkward but more or less effective
fuller once more, clipped hard to square leg, and good sharp running
on the toes, flipped to the leg side
speared down the leg side, full length, and no contact this time
blotted into the covers, and a direct hit would have been very tight! It would have been miles out! Porterfield from gully makes great ground but shying off balance and can't connect

edged and gone again! Murtagh lures the loose stroke, pushing hard at a ball that left him off the pitch, Stirling snaffles the offering at second slip, and Ireland keep chipping away! Just when he seemed to be settling into his day's work, Babar is gone!
flicked to the leg side, a bit of a misfield but no run there
off the mark with a brace, into the covers
chipped to the leg side, working the full length
fully forward and blocked back down the pitch
full toss, a touch loose, but no real damage done, a firm drive into the covers
very wide line, lured into a drive into the gap in the covers
much tighter, a good follow-up, Sarfraz blocks to the leg side
full length, and sliced high and effectively over third man! Might as well fling the bat when the ball is in the arc
solidly forward, and blocked down the ground
a flogged cover-drive, but can't beat the fielder
no stroke outside off
hustles back into the crease as a defensive block scuttles past the off stump. Close but no cigar
caressed off the back foot, into the covers
firmly forward, and blocked back down the pitch
edged but safe! Another genuine nick, kissing the edge of a firmly planted front-foot block, but dies short of third slip and zips away to safety
very full once more, solidly onto the front foot, head right over the ball
guided with an open face
crunched through the covers, lovely fluid strike
stabbed to the off side
reaching forward to meet the full length, steered into the off side once more
stunning ball. Beautiful length, hits the seam, climbs past the edge, through to the keeper before the batsman can flinch. Touch that if you can!
another beauty to end the over, just standing the seam up straight and letting the pitch do the work. A lesson for all in helpful conditions
on the back foot, pushed to the off side with a bit of unease. That leaping bounce, like Chris Tremlett of old, is awkward no matter what the pace
tapped to the off side
angled into the pads, clipped to the leg side
pops up and over the slips once again! Another shoulder-of-the-bat job, and short of posting a fly-slip there's no legislating for that.
tapped to the leg side
leg-sided and wriggles through the keeper's clutches too.
works off the stumps into the midwicket area
touch too straight again, nicely timed into the leg side but can't find the gap
full outside off, left alone
the bottom hand comes into play as he tries to shovel a full delivery away, ends up finding mid-off
he's not tempted into having a drive at this full delivery, leaves it alone
this time he does drive, the delivery is fuller, doesn't time the shot and finds cover
back of a length, defended off his hip to the leg side...he's overstepped
way down the leg side, a tumbling take for O'Brien
short and pulled out to deep square leg...takes him to his half-century. An important innings
back over the wicket, short of a length at the body, worked to the leg side
fuller, outside off, defended coming forward
back of a length, nudged towards square leg
another short ball and he's quickly onto that, pulled very sweetly wide of square leg...got over the top of it
top shot! Doesn't get much better. A full delivery with a hint of shape away, met with the full face of the bat as he gets a good stride forward and places it wide of mid-off. Textbook
drags the length back, on off stump, defended to cover
finds the edge...but wide of second slip and there's no third anymore! Good delivery, in the channel outside off stump, Shafiq just prodding away from his body
left alone this time, similar delivery to the edge
gets forward and pushes to the covers
uses his feet and comes at the bowler, then pushes towards mid-on and nabs a sharp single...good proactive batting
round the wicket again, short at off stump, the pull shot is dragged towards square leg
another bouncer, this one pitches outside leg and carries over his back as he ducks underneath
short at leg stump, he neatly inside the line, rolls his wrists and pulls to long leg
well outside leg stump for this bouncer, loops through harmlessly down the leg side
good length at off stump, defended into backward point
another short ball to end the over, comes reasonably slowly off the surface

pushes forward to a full delivery outside off, beats a diving backward point and deep cover gets some work...a more defensive field now for Ireland. They run two, but it's called one short. Looked a tight call as Shafiq turned for the second
drives out to deep point
good delivery, full outside off and late shape on it, Sarfraz lifts the bat out of the line at the last moment
a short delivery outside off, played at the top of bounce through point to the sweeper
length ball at off stump, defended
driven neatly to mid-off
round the wicket, short, over his back
short of a length, he stays back and defends down by his feet
on the pads, deflects into the leg side
the short ball has worked! Well, whatever you think of the tactic it's paid off. Banged in halfway down, he goes for the pull again, can't keep this one down and offers a catch to square leg
over the wicket, full and straight, worked wide of mid-on to get off the mark straightaway
round the wicket, a bouncer which Sarfraz lets go through
short outside off and a waft from Shadab which almost brings an edge
that's a horrid delivery, flung down the leg side, O'Brien needs to bring out a dive
that's a good 'un! Finds the channel outside off, bounces a touch more, too, as it skims past the edge
fuller, driven to mid-off
very full, on the popping crease, jabbed into the off side
full and straight, pushed just to the right of mid-on who can't stop the single
full at middle, defended with a straight bat
left alone outside off
short of a length at off stump, pushes towards point and looks for the single but is sent back by Sarfraz
pushed down the leg side
full at off stump, very nicely driven straight of mid-off. Lovely piece of timing
responds with a bouncer which Shadab ducks
length ball outside off, plays it late with an open face and finds gully
delivered from very wide on the crease, angled in full outside off, left alone
through to the keeper
full on the stumps, worked into midwicket

another catch into the slips! And that's a big giveaway from Sarfraz. Short of a length outside off and a very careless glide straight to second slip, neat grab from Stirling. As though he was given slip catches before play. Ireland keep chipping away
almost gone first ball! A nervous poke at a short-of-a-length delivery angled across the left hander, climbed too, and carries over the top edge
full outside off, left alone
poor ball, wide outside off, flayed square through the off side. Stand and deliver from Shadab
edged, just short of second slip! Full at off stump, Shadab getting forward, draws the outside edge but he just manages to get it to ground
all action at the moment, this time he gets forward and drives compactly through the covers...still some late swing for Kane
full outside off, left alone
driven into the covers without much timing
back of a length on leg stump, inside edge into his thigh pad which trickles to the leg side to get him his first Test run
full, angled in at middle stump, played to the leg side
full and straight, defended
full outside off, gets forward and drives to mid-off
nudged into the leg side between mid-on and midwicket
swings across the left hander outside off, left alone
length ball with some width outside off, guided behind point and the sweeper can't stop the second
flicked off the pads to mid-on
full outside off, defended towards point
drives a full delivery to mid-off
length ball at off stump, defended to the covers
left alone
short of a length at off stump, pushed to mid-off from the back foot
fuller, at middle and off, some late shape, defended to point
full, very wide, he chases it with a flat-footed drive and there's a half-hearted appeal for a catch behind but think bat hit ground
short outside off, this time it carries over the top edge as he looks to square cut
full at off stump, defended
on leg stump, worked off the pads down to long leg
over the wicket, full and straight, punched to mid-on
good length outside off, defended to cover
that's a terrific shot! Just back of a length outside off, punched very sweetly straight down the ground, beats mid-off and can't be stopped
and another strong shot...a fuller ball, gets a big stride forward and drives through the covers
nearly gets through, comes forward to a full delivery and traps it into his pad off the inside edge
comes forward and steers a drive into the covers
too much width, and dragged down, dispatched through point with a strong square cut
edged, between second slip and gully! Fuller, wide outside off, Shadab reaches for it and gets another boundary to third man
full, wide outside off, left alone
nearly finds the edge, this angles in towards off stump then shapes away to beat Shadab's halfhearted poke
square drives to deep point
full at middle and leg, some late swing into the pads, clipped through square leg and that's very good running
full at middle and off, defended
a touch too full for the square cut he tried, gets a bottom edge which bobbles towards the slips
full, very wide, perhaps a slower ball, driven to short cover
touch of uncertainty here but he gets away with it, slides off the face of the bat and runs wide of slip towards third man...he made a very late decision to try and leave it
an inswinger, starts too straight and slips down the leg side
angled into the hip, a good take by O'Brien down the leg side
on the back foot, outside off and pushed to cover
short, wide, slapped. A post-tea loosener, pelted through backward point
better line and good shape away from the left-hander. Blocked
on the back foot, blocked back into the off side, and some scrappy fielding gives away the overthrows! A wild shy from cover, and Murtagh can't intercept
punched back down the pitch
too short and wide once more, but Kane gets away with it this time, flat-batted out to deep cover
edged, and did that carry? Stirling at second slip, making good ground to his right, but can't quite reach a hard-handed drive. We think that was a seven-ball over ...
pushed to mid-on
dropped! Murtagh did everything right there, turning the batsman inside-out with good nip on middle stump, angled away, kisses the edge, and Wilson at first slip can't sight it low in front of him
inswing to the left-hander on a full length, driven without timing into the covers
worked back down the pitch, squared up a touch by a tight line
tapped back down the line of the ball, tight once more from Murtagh
booming late swing and a fine low take from O'Brien but that misses everything
up on the toes, punched into the covers
outside off, no stroke offered
another fine delivery, ghosting away from a loose drive and gathered low by O'Brien
cracked through the covers, standing tall on the back foot, firm connection
outside off, no stroke this time
back of a length, whipped out to deep midwicket
up on the toes, defended back down the track
loopy full length, dipping late into the toes and worked to mid-on with a high-elbowed push
ideal length once more, drawing the batsman forward, threatening to nip off the seam
punched down the pitch
pops from a good length, Ashraf is slightly startled as he loosens his bottom hand, but plays it well in the end
on the back foot, punched to mid-off
short and wide, outside off stump, slapped into the covers
full length, dangerous shape on the ball as Shadab thinks about the drive but thinks better of it
wider line, more comfortable leave this time
punched into the covers, firm stroke for no run
too much width once again, and slapped comfortably out to deep point
back of a length, sliding towards leg stump, doesn't get up much, and guided to midwicket
onto the front foot, drawn forward with intent, gathered at point
onto the front foot, tapped to the off side, sharp running
outside off, attempted back-cut but can't connect
slow yorker, drops to the popping crease like a doodlebug, and duly dug out with a stab of the bat
onto the front foot, drilled to cover, and a good stop to cut off the runs
very full, stabbed down into the crease
outside off, slapped to backward point
stabbed back to the bowler
speared into the toes, worked behind square with a flurry of bat and limbs
on the back foot, working the outswinger back to the bowler
tremendous strike! Easing a half-volley back down the track, using the angle to free the arms and pierce the field
on the back foot, flashed to short cover with an uppish push
shorter, sharper, but down the leg side, no contact on a swishy pull
better line to complement the bouncy length, tucked up a touch in defence
oh, unlucky for Rankin! Another savage lifter from a good length, explodes off the splice but plops tantalisingly short of the cordon!
hauled across the line, out to square leg
retreats to leg a touch to make room to drive Rankin's awkward line. Doesn't connect properly, but Shadab is being made to dance a touch
driven on the up, out through square leg, a touch inside-edgy there
worked to leg, good length once more
driven off another inside-edge to square leg
rolls the fingers on a wider line, no stroke this time
down the leg side, attempted flick off the hip
an ambitious appeal for lbw from Thompson. That would have been about as out as Nasser v Wasim at Faisalabad in 2000...
left alone
leaning back and absolutely mullahed through the leg side! The most belligerent stroke of the day, picking the length early and dispatching it through midwicket
nip off the deck, thuds into the thigh pad and loops out to point
punched out to point
up on the toes, worked to the leg side
pushed onto the back foot, and blocked to the off side
attempted pull, more signs of intent, but this is under-edged into the crease
short, and an attempted pull off the hip, the keeper saunters round to gather
angled into the pads, can't work this one away, as a loud thud echoes around the ground
outside off, attempted cut, can't connect properly as the cordon tidies up
worked into the off side
through to the keeper, no stroke this time
inside-edged defence, feet stuck in the crease for that stroke. A touch fortuitious
another filleted four, too much width once again, and a rolling-wristed cut through the cordon pierces the gap at third man
beauty! This one explodes from a good length, and hops obediently into O'Brien's gloves

edged and dropped! Oh dear, that was a big chance, an involuntary jab from a good length outside off, sharp edge between keeper and first slip, and O'Brien's dive possibly put Wilson off... a big moment... and the ball ricochets to the rope too
salt in the wounds time... smashed through the off side
and another four! This is a morale-crushing over for Ireland. Tickled through fine leg this time
solidly pressed into the covers, and well enough placed to turn for two and bring up a fifty on debut. It's Ireland's big day, but it's a Pakistani new boy who reaches his first landmark
too wide from Thompson
crunched off the back foot, can't time it properly, but that's more runs to the tally
outside off, no stroke offered
back of a length, a swishing drive but no great connection
through to the keeper once more
dribbles through low to the keeper as Shadab shoulders arms
nipping away on a full length, no stroke offered
through to the keeper once more
striding forward to meet the full length, but left alone
tapped down into the off side as O'Brien comes round the wicket to the left-hander
floaty full length, Faheem can't time his drive
swept straight up, through backward square
outside off, a touch short,  but point tidies up
on the back foot, squirted to the off side
round the wicket, met with a full face on off stump, pushed to cover
over the wicket to the right-hander, tapped to the leg side
back of a length, chopped to backward point and up comes Shadab's fifty! Tremendous innings, one that has taken the momentum clean out of Ireland's day
solidly onto the front foot
round the wicket, wide line, no stroke offered
firmly bunted back at the bowler's shins
on the pads, flipped through the leg side and up comes the hundred stand. Tremendous blend of attrition and counterattack, with a bit of luck here and there too
uppishly slapped down to third man, Faheem slipped while turning for the second, and that could have been a cruel end to the stand! Crisis averted though
outside off, through to the keeper
keeps low on off stump, a tight line and awkwardly blocked
tossed up this time, and flogged ambitiously through the covers
round the wicket, turning into the left-hander, who attempts a nudge off the hip
oh, hello, a massive launch into the stands at long-on! Got right underneath the ball and walloped it high and mightily through the line
cautiously forward as a follow-up
solid in defence to finish the over
very full length, big outswing, Shadab reaches with flat feet and pushes tentatively to cover
well bowled, tight curling line from middle and leg to off, and blocked on the crease line
outside off, a bit of swing, through to the keeper
pushed out to cover, working with the outswing
good carry through to the keeper, as O'Brien dives to his left to gather
very full length, dug out on the crease
flashed out to deep cover with an open face
down the leg side, Faheem misses with his attempted glance
stands tall on the back foot to push back down the line of the ball
tapped out past point, and beats an ambitous leaping attempt to gather
outside off, no great carry, through to the keeper
more of the same, a diligent line and length but no need to play at that
full length, nipping away, draws a flashy loose drive, but through to the keeper
blocked into the covers, looking for the quick single but Porterfield closes in swiftly, they have to abort
through to the keeper once more
edged and did that carry? Balbirnie stretched low to his left at second slip but the ball was always heading down. Close!
standing tall on the back foot, and punched to the covers
lured into a tentative poke outside off, good carry this time, and through to the keeper
flashed out to the off side
tight line outside off, a hint of nip off the seam but no great carry. Watchfully left
short and wide and slapped to cover
drilled along the ground, out to deep cover
no stroke this time
just back of a length, pushed to cover
outside off, no great carry but a threatening line. Dribbles through to the keeper. Not sure he'll have many more with the old nut on that evidence
pushed onto the back foot to defend
an extra slip in place as Faheem dabs this first ball into the covers and sets off for the sharp single

big appeal and out! Murtagh strikes in his first over of the morning! Fuller length, tighter line, Shadab was playing across the line and was thumped on the front pad. Potentially wasn't doing enough to hit leg stump, but there's no DRS here, so no recourse for the batsman!
outside off, through to the keeper with three slips and a gully lurking
good line and length, a bit of nip outside off, and Faheem plays and misses
squared up on a full length, defended back down the pitch
a big swing and a miss. Dangled outside off stump, and Faheem figured 'why not?' No contact, but plenty intent!
a squirty drive from a very full length, gathered in the gully
on the toes, tucked to short midwicket and they scamper through as Thompson runs around to his right hand
bouncing down the leg side, can't get a tickle on that one
A lovely straight drive, clean down the ground
pops a touch on Faheem who pokes down late into the turf
back of a length and angling away outside off, keeps low and sneaks under the bat. Beaten
fuller than a good length, and angling away slightly to beat him and hit the pad again
Amir throws his bat at a good length ball angling away in the channel. He drives and only collects thin air
Rankin goes past the outside edge, again. Much fuller and nibbling away in the channel, Amir is rooted to the crease as he drives and misses
good length and finishes wide outside off, Amir shoulders arms
pitched up and angling away outside off, closer to off stump, Amir is pinned to the crease as he wafts a drive between slips and gully
short on middle, Amir gets behind the line and fends it off to cover
chest-high short ball on middle stump, Faheem takes it on with a hook. Hit on the bounce to deep square leg
Dropped by the substitute fielder. Murtagh draws the outside edge but McBrine at third slip shells it. Full and angling away outside off, the batsman drives away from the body and gets away
good length on middle, played back
pretty full on of stump, presses forward and pats it to mid-off
full and nipping away outside off, Faheem plays inside the line and is beaten on the outside edge
full and attacking off stump, Amir opts to hang back and defend it back to the bowler
slightly overpitched and angling away outside off, Faheem reaches out for the ball and squirts a drive through point
short and aimed at the body from over the wicket, Amir hops, skips, and fends it back to the bowler
back of a length and skidding into the thigh pad, Amir falls over the flick, and misses
nice and full on a fourth-stump line, Amir inches forward, does not meet the pitch, and push-drives to cover
there's the hit-the-deck bustle from Rankin. He runs in hard, hits the pitch harder, finds extra bounce from a length. The batsman hangs his bat out and is beaten on the outside edge
much fuller on middle, Amir sits back and nurdles a single to midwicket
picked off the pads through the square-leg region for one
floated full on middle stump, Faheem plays around his front pad and works the ball away to the leg side
full and sliding into the pads, clipped off the back foot to midwicket
much fuller on off stump, jabbed back to the bowler
good length and angling across off, squirted away in the gap between gully and backward point. Rolls away off the outside half
Murtagh hits a hard length, kicks up outside off, stabbed off the back foot to backward point
nice and full on off stump, Amir rocks forward and drives it back to the bowler
Faheem moves to 80 with a firm pull. Dug in short and outside off, just below the chest, he swivels on the back foot and nails it to the midwicket boundary
short, again, on middle, rolls out another pull, this time straight to deep square leg
short and angling away outside off, Amir gets on his tippy toes and punches it sweetly through the covers. 300 up for Pakistan
back of a length and angling away outside off, Amir rides the bounce and dabs to the cordon
full and on middle, defended back to the bowler
banged in short and slanting away outside off, the batsman arches his back and lets it go. The ball dies on its way to the keeper
full and homing in at off against the angle, Amir jumps back in the crease and keeps it out
full and angling across off, Amir has an almighty swing at it but the ball swerves away and beats him lavishly
full on off, Amir hangs back in the crease and pokes it to the leg side
full and angling across off, no shot
good length and nibbling away just a shade outside off, Amir plays inside the line and gets beaten on the outside edge
really full on off, tip and run to the covers. Smart running
floated full and nibbling away outside off, ignored in the channel
back of a length on middle, Amir ventures deep in the crease and blocks to point
starts outside leg and catches the pad as the batsman falls over the flick
fuller and leaves Amir in the channel, he chases after a drive and does not connect
short and angling away outside off, jabbing punch to point
full and wider than a set of stumps outside off, no shot
back of a length, nips away off the surface, finds the outside of Amir's bat before rolling towards point
good length, angled across and straightening around middle, blocked down the pitch
full and angled across but straightening late just outside off, Amir swings big and loses shape as the ball shoots past the outside edge
length ball that angles across and has Amir squared up
good length, nice shape on off, Amir shuffles across and blocks from the crease
back of a length on the fifth-stump channel, shuffles across and blocks towards cover
short outside off, Faheem jumps and cuts to cover
short and wide, slashed to deep backward point for one
fullish length, swings away sharply from a fifth-stump line, left alone
short of a length on leg stump, jumps up and tucks to backward square leg
that's a brilliant delivery. No century for Faheem but a brute from Thompson. Pitches outside leg, gets big on him and seams away before getting the glove to the keeper. Top delivery
length ball, curves in towards off and then straightens late, Abbas is caught in two minds and ends up inadvertently knocking it to the off side as he's late in withdrawing his bat
short of good length on off, Amir gets on top of it and defends to the extra cover region
back of a length on off, Amir stands tall and blocks
fullish, swings in sharply towards middle and leg, turned away in front of square on the leg side
pushes away from the body and gets an outside edge to this away-nipper that rolls past third slip
back of a length, squares him up as it nips away late, and there's bit of a low bounce as well which results in the ball shooting past the outside edge

he's nicely set up Amir there. There was the one that came in, one that went away, a back of a length delivery, and now a fullish one that Amir is drawn forward to. But he can't cover for the swing away from him and promptly gets an outside edge to the keeper
length ball, slight shape away, left alone outside off
backs away to a short of a length delivery and gets thoroughly beaten as the delivery jags away off the deck
full, angling in towards off and swinging away, beaten on the outside edge
fullish, angled in towards the stumps. Abbas doesn't bother moving his feet and swings big but the ball swings away and has him beaten
fuller again and opens him up with movement and finds the outside edge towards the cordon
full, angled in on the pads, rolls off it behind the stumps
fullish delivery that straightens around a set of stumps outside off, left alone
full, angled in at the pads, pushed down to mid-on
swinging away, left alone outside off
length ball that nips away, left alone
full and straight on leg stump, dabbed down the pitch
full, swings away from off, left alone
skewed off the toe-end over the cordon. Gets nowhere close to the line and swipes across the line to the leg side and ends up knocking it in the air
back of a length, slight movement outside off, left alone
length ball, backs away too much and ends up feeling for it, beaten
full, nips away slightly, finds the outside of the bat as he fends at it from the crease
backs away but the bowler follows him with a short of a length delivery that Abbas blocks from the crease
first runs for Ireland in Test cricket. Soak it in. Back of a length and holds its line outside off, Joyce hops and guides to point, where the fielder fumbles
dug in short and outside off, no swing or seam movement for Amir, left alone
full and angling in from wide of the crease, Porterfield presses forward and taps to cover
nice and tight on off, Porterfield gets forward, meets the pitch, and drives to mid-off
pretty full on off, defended back to the bowler
back of a length and climbs in the channel, Porterfield simply watches it through to the keeper
floated full on the pads, neatly picked off through the square leg region for three

Abbas draws an appeal for lbw. Good length, pitches on off, and nips away, Porterfield pads up to it, hoping for more movement. He wears it on the back thigh. It pitched in line but would have bounced over the stumps
full and angling across off, forward and squirted through point off the outside half
full and straight, presses forward and nudges to midwicket

Abbas draws another appeal for lbw, this time umpire Illingworth raises his finger. Full inswinger from Abbas, shapes back in, Joyce hangs back and plays all around it. This might have clipped leg stump but was the impact in line with leg stump? Tight, tight call. May have pitched just outside leg
full and outside off, pushed to cover
full, angling in, shapes away outside off, no shot
back of a length, kicks up, and seams in the channel, whizzes past the outside edge
full outside off, swings away in the air, he hangs his bat out and is beaten on the outside edge
gets behind the line of this shortish ball outside off and defends
full, angling in from wide of the crease, swinging in, clipped away to midwicket
fuller and angling in from wide of the crease, then straightening away to run past the outside edge. Excellent bowling from Amir
good length and slanting in on off stump, Balbirnie presses forward, meets the pitch, and pushes back to the bowler
on a length and holds its line outside off, left alone
floated full and outside off, ignored
good length on middle, defended back to the bolwer
on a length and climbs outside off, no shot

Is Balbirnie run-out? He aims for a risky single but is forced to undo his steps. Sharp work from Imam, swooping to his right at forward short leg, then nailing the stumps at the striker's end. Balbirnie turns back swiftly, dishes out a full-length dive and beats the throw to make his crease. This was full on the pads, clipped away. Imam stops the ball with one hand and hits the stumps, but it's not enough to dismiss Balbirnie
full, starts outside off, and swings away further, no shot
back of a length and angling in on middle from wide of the crease, whisked to midwicket
back of a length on a fourth-stump line, hint of away movement, ignored
Porterfield plays for the incoming angle but it straightens away to beat the outside edge
full on middle, presses forward and drives to mid-on
back of a length outside off, from wide of the crease, again, left alone

Abbas finds inswing again, this time Balbirnie is pinned in front. Nice and full, angling, shaping in from over the wicket. Pitches in line, the batsman plays around his front pad, and falls over. This would have cannoned into middle and leg stumps
fended off the hips to the left of short leg
floated full and outside off, left alone in the channel
full on a fourth-stump line, presses forward and eases it to mid-off
full and nipping away outside off, Niall O'Brien leaves it be
full and Abbas explores the corridor, Niall doesn't

Amir floors the off stump and sets off on a celebratory sprint. He relishes the wicket. Amir ventures wide of the crease and gets it to skid back in from over the wicket, Porterfield is beaten for pace, he plays inside the line of it and loses his off stump. What a terrific sight for a fast bowler. Perfect end to the session for Pakistan
tight leg-stump line to launch the session. Thuds into the pad but well outside the line
pushed with hard hands past the lurking short leg, full and straight, threatening to swing too. Dicey
outside off, through to the keeper
back of a length, attacking the top of off, punched compactly up to mid-off
forward and into the covers
dropped onto a good length on and around the left-hander's off stump, and blocked
on the back foot, poked to the leg side
forward, and blocked
well left in the end, with a Jack Russell-esque curtain-rail pull inside the line

pinned on the knee-roll and Ireland are in tatters! Caught on the crease, and a hostage to the late nip back off the seam. No option there but to stick up the finger and sink this innings further into the mire!
zoinks, that was close! A hustling wicket-to-wicket line, skidded through low and needed an urgent late adjustment to save the off stump from a thumping!
into line to defend into the covers
angled across the right-hander, and through to the keeper with a shouldering of arms
onto the front foot, and punched hard into the covers. Good intent
on the back foot, squared up in defence
goes round the wicket and bowls a length ball in the sixth-stump channel. Left well alone
length ball angling in towards off stump, defended to mid-on
this time the angle takes it down the leg side, too far from his body for O'Brien to play it

yikes, so nearly a wicket! Back of a length, a bit of width too, but there isn't too much bounce on this pitch and the ball doesn't come on for the cut. KOB has a big slash at it and inside-edges it past his stumps
back of a length on middle stump, defended back towards the bowler

full outside off, and that's nicely played. Not too much overpitched from Abbas so far, and KOB leans on this nicely, just eases it to mid-off's right, prioritising placement and weight transfer over power
fullish in the fifth-stump channel, and Stirling gets a good stride in to defend into the cover point region
fullish, slanting across towards off stump, gets forward for a checked punch to mid-off, who's stationed quite wide, almost at short extra-cover
shortish outside off and O'Brien has another swish at it, much like that inside-edged four in the previous over. This time the ball misses his bat, sneaks under it and through to the keeper
length ball on off stump, defended into the point region
back of a length, slanting across to off stump, gets across to defend into the on side, and the bowler fields it in his follow-through
ooh, excellent change-up, right up in the blockhole on off stump with a bit of late inswing. O'Brien jams his bat down juuuust in time to keep it out
full again, on off stump, though not in the blockhole on this occasion. Jabbed back to the bowler

shot! Stirling loves that point region, and Abbas, who's been relentlessly stump-to-stump so far, offers him a bit of width. Not a bad length, but there's just enough room for Stirling to free his arms and play a front-foot cut to the right of backward point. The first middled boundary in Irish Test history
now he overcompensates and slides onto Stirling's pads, and he tucks it away neatly to the left of long leg
full and once again on Stirling's legs. Flicked off the toes to long leg
fullish on off stump and O'Brien - who's taking guard outside leg stump - steps across and then leans forward, into a nice, full-face drive to the left of the diving bowler

good leave! Not a facet we see often of Stirling's game in limited-overs cricket. A good length ball angling in from wide of the crease, and it's into that fourth-stump channel. Judges it well and shoulders arms
a touch short, a hint of width, and Stirling lays into it again, that front-foot slash, this time through the cover point region
he does, straightaway. Full, tailing in towards middle and leg, and he does well to get his front pad out of the way and squeeze that into the leg side
swing again, but starts too straight. Back of a length, curls down the leg side and O'Brien can't connect with the flick
length ball swinging in towards middle stump. Lets it come on and plays late to tuck it to square leg

ooh, good ball. Again some swing in towards middle stump and O'Brien, planting his front foot forward and playing around his front pad, flicks it behind square leg when he was probably looking to hit it in the direction of midwicket
fullish, no swing this time, angles across instead into the fourth-stump channel. O'Brien gets on the front foot to push it to the right of mid-off
fullish on off stump, defended to mid-off
length ball in the fourth-stump channel, gets a good stride forward for a checked drive to the left of mid-off
full, a little wider than the previous ball, and Stirling gets that positive stride forward once more, lets the ball come to him, and opens his bat face to drive to the right of backward point

oh, no, no no! Stirling was looking so good, and he perishes to a rash shot. It was back of a length with a fair bit of width, perhaps in the slot for his favourite front-foot cut, but he goes for the pull instead. The ball nips away off the pitch, perhaps stops on him too, catches the toe-end of the bat, and loops up for extra-cover to take a simple catch
fullish, slanting across to off stump, driven to short extra-cover
full, floated across outside off, and he drives firmly but straight to short extra-cover
back of a length on off stump, defended to short extra-cover
length ball slanting into the fifth-stump channel, plenty of width for KOB to lean forward and drive into the big gap in the covers
fullish on off stump, blocked back to the bowler

ooh, that stopped on him. Good length, drawing O'Brien halfway forward for a push into the covers, and it stops and nips back slightly, takes the inside edge and hits his pad. Balloons a short distance into the leg side - could easily have popped back to the bowler instead
length ball on off stump, defended to mid-on
fullish, fourth-stump line, O'Brien gets half-forward and bunts it gently into the cover region to pick up one

ooh, beauty. Fullish on middle stump, curls away late towards off stump. Thompson is crease-bound in defence, and the ball squirts off the outside half of his bat towards point. He wanted to play that into the covers or towards mid-off
ooh! Back of a length, straightens a touch in the fifth-stump channel, and beats the outside edge as O'Brien plays away from his body, feeling for the ball
back of a length, a little closer to off stump, defends into the point region without really moving his feet
back of a length, a bit of width, and he stands tall and punches firmly, only for Imam to dive to his right at extra-cover and stop it
looks for the off-stump yorker, doesn't quite nail it. Defended to midwicket
length ball in the fifth-stump channel, defended into the point region
length ball close to off stump, punched to mid-off
nicely bowled. He's been going full, full, full. Now he goes short in the corridor, gets some away movement and extra bounce, and beats Thompson's hesitant prod
beats him again. More swing, from a fuller length this time, and starts wider outside off. Thompson has a big swish at it without moving his feet, with predictable results
full now, on off stump, clipped into the midwicket region
length ball slanting across towards off stump. Leans forward and pushes gently to the left of mid-off
back of a length on off stump, gets on the back foot and defends to the right of the bowler
length ball close to off stump, punched to mid-off
length ball angling into off stump, defended to mid-off
looks to test him with the bouncer, and it's a good one, rising towards his right shoulder, but he does well to hook it around, all along the ground, to the man at deep backward square leg
back of a length, straightening towards middle stump. Stays besides the line to defend, and inside-edges into his body. The ball rolls away into the off side to permit the quick single
back of a length, and a rare bit of width. O'Brien waits nicelyon it and opens his bat face to guide it into the big gap to the right of third slip. No gully for Faheem, remember
in the blockhole, close to off stump, defended to mid-on
length ball on middle stump, flicked away nicely to long leg to bring up Ireland's fifty and prompt a ripple of applause around Malahide
length ball, a bit of swerve in towards off stump, defended to midwicket. Was initially aiming towards the covers, and had to adjust for the swing
shortish, close to off stump, gets on his toes to ride the bounce and defend towards point. Nicely played
length ball on off stump, defended to mid-off, showing the full face again. He's looked very good while playing down the ground
short now, on leg stump, gets up to about chest height. Swivels around quickly to pull to long leg
full, a bit of swing away from off stump. Doesn't quite get his front foot forward, but gets his head over the ball for a push to the right of mid-off
back of a length close to off stump, opens his bat face to dab towards backward point
full, close to off stump, gets forward to drive to mid-off with a decent amount of bottom hand

nicely bowled. Good length, slanting across the left-hander, close enough to off stump to force him to play. Doesn't get his front foot across or forward at all, and a bit of extra bounce beats him by a long way
back of a length on middle stump, gets back and across to defend into the on side
back of a length on middle and off, defended to short extra-cover
length ball on off stump, punched back firmly towards the bowler
full, angling into off stump, driven to extra-cover
length ball on off stump, slides on straight. O'Brien gets on the front foot to defend back down the pitch
was that the googly? Maybe just went straight on again, but released from wider on the crease. Looks to defend down the pitch and plays it towards short leg instead, off the inner half of the bat
a touch shorter on off stump, goes back to defend into the off side
shortish again, goes back and across and works it away through square leg. No turn at all yet
back of a length outside off, defended into the point region
tossed up fuller on off stump, gets forward to defend to midwicket
length ball close to off stump, defended to short extra
length ball, fourth-stump line, nice stride forward for the checked drive to mid-off
back of a length outside off, O'Brien shuffles across to defend and gets a thick outside edge that bounces away to the right of the gully fielder. Was on the move when he played that shot

nicely bowled, and O'Brien has a needless poke at a ball wide of off stump. On the shorter side of a good length, may have been better served playing it off the back foot. Pushes forward and pushes his hands at the ball, and it seams away to beat his edge
this one's fuller and closer to off stump, and O'Brien times it away gloriously. Just leans into the drive and bisects extra-cover and mid-off
back of a length in the fifth-stump channel, a bit of away movement, but the shortish length allows him to adjust. Looks to guide it away to third man and gully dives left to make a spectacular stop
runs into the leg side off a thickish inside edge as he plays forward

cleaned him up! He's basically played all round this one. Pitched just outside off, looking to work it too square really and completely misses. Went straight on. To be fair, the previous one did spin a bit. So a nice set-up by Shadab
over the wicket, full outside off, goes straight on and is left alone

and another! Edged to gully off the pad The slide continues. Think this may have been the googly, spun back a fraction, he was on the back foot looking to work to leg, gets an inside edge into his pad which loops to the close catcher
leans forward on off stump, defended
touch shorter, pushed square through the off side with an open face
full outside off, left alone
jabs a full delivery along the ground towards gully
full at off stump, defended to mid-off...caught a little on the back foot
wide, pushed well across the right hander, through to the keeper
nicely bowled, good length at middle and off, hint of seam movement, scoots off a thickish inside edge to the leg side
gets forward to a length delivery, comes off an inside edge into his front pad
gets down early and plays a neat paddle-sweep through short fine leg...taken from around off stump
another googly, he presses forward and defends
wider outside off, a little shorter as well, think Wilson just pulled his bat inside the line at the last moment
full on the stumps, defended
fuller still, at off stump, dead-batted to the off side
defended on the back foot
good call from Wilson, O'Brien squeezed this between his legs, defended a full delivery, to the on side and wasn't sure where the ball was...Wilson alert to chance to get through
another sharp run...short of a length, defended off the back foot towards the covers
full at off stump, defended on the front foot
back of a length, a middle and leg line, defended to the leg side
nicely bowled, pushed up fuller and angled across outside off, encourages a drive and beats the outside edge
short of a length, pulled through square leg and there's a man out on the boundary
a strangled appeal for lbw, think there was an inside edge. Another wrong 'un. No bat, it was just sliding down leg
defended to the leg side
full at the stumps, he comes forward and blocks
touch more air on this one, full and straight, decent stride forward
dragged down a little short, driven off the back foot to deep cover
full outside off, Wilson across his crease and defends with a slightly open face
a half volley outside off, nicely driven off the front foot but he picks out mid-off
opens the face at a length delivery angled across him, runs it down to third man
left alone outside off, nice carry through to the keeper. Taken at chest height from a good length delivery
good length at middle and off, defended from the crease towards point
flung across wide outside off, he doesn't play
short of a length on leg stump, nudged off the hip towards square leg. He seems to coping okay at the moment
this scoots through low outside off, under the bottom as Wilson aims to play square
straighter delivery, full at middle and off, stride forward to defend
nicely tossed up, much fuller, takes an inside edge into his pad but bobbles safely away
a little shorter, he's onto the back foot and pushes square to the off side
a terrific delivery! Perfect leg-break. Pitches just outside off, draws him forward, spins past the outside edge
straighter one to end the offer, skids on a little, pushed to the leg side...very nice stuff from Shadab
over the wicket, good length at middle, defended to point
lovely-looking shot but without the placement, onto the front foot and drives a very full delivery straight to mid-off
not so full this time, but again O'Brien is driving confidently, this time he picks out cover
straight to cover! O'Brien has been keen to have a drive. Goes for it again, this time more on the up, can't keep it down and it's a neat snaffle by Imam at cover
gets the bat down to a full delivery outside off although he certainly wasn't getting forward, trickles off the edge towards the slips
excellent yorker! Almost gets through, and it's a good effort from Rankin to jab the bat down quickly enough
full at off stump, defended
across to off stump, played with bat and pad together
drives a full delivery to cover
that's a beauty! Was it an edge? Not sure. A leg-break that spun past the bat, beat off stump and wasn't gloved by Sarfraz
runs off a thick inside edge as he plays forward, past short leg
straighter delivery, drifts in towards middle, defended to the off side
neatly played, a length ball angled into Rankin who tucks it past square leg
huge appeal for lbw, not given! Was it sneaking down the leg side? Length ball which nipped back, struck the back leg, he was a long way back but, yes, angling down leg
back of a length outside off, pushed to point
full and straight, a hint of Rankin staying leg side of the ball, defended to mid-on
full at off stump, played up to mid-on
gets across the crease this time and defends a full delivery outside off to the covers
a little short outside off, gives him the chance to drive off the back foot to deep cover...he's content to expose Rankin to the strike
through him, and misses everything! Tossed up outside off, Rankin eyes a booming drive, is beaten by the spin and goes past leg stump. Lot of dust out of the rough
and now this one goes straight on, beats the outside edge
bat on ball, rolls off the outside edge wide of slip
dropped by slip! Very full outside off, Wilson drives and gets an edge which glances off Sarfraz's pad and beatsslip. A tough one, to be fair, with the deflection
a googly comes off the inside edge to the leg side
full outside off, left alone
angled across, good length, shoulders arms
just short of a length, a little wide, left alone
fuller, he comes forward and pushes to the off side...comes from the bottom of the bat
short of a length outside off, through to the keeper...Amir's radar not quite right in this over
fuller, doesn't make him play, angles in a little from round the wicket but left alone
spins in from outside off, takes the pads as Rankins tries to work through the leg side
much fuller, brings an lbw appeal...didn't look a bad shout as Rankin whips across the line. Maybe going down leg, but it was very full
driven towards mid-off
takes an inside edge to the leg side
a wider line outside off, brings Wilson forward and he pushes towards point
short of a length outside off, pushes towards cover...Rankin was keen for the run but it wasn't there
a bouncer, which evades everyone and everything...it's a good effort to get one over Rankin's head, Sarfraz can't gather with a leap
back on a full length outside off, pushed to the covers
full again, not much footwork from Rankin, played towards point
a yorker nearly gets through! Late dip in towards off stump, takes the inside edge as Rankin brings the bat down and it squeezes past the stumps
another very short bouncer, loops over Wilson's head, Sarfraz takes it one-handed moving towards first slip
length ball, pitches outside leg stump, clipped to the man at leg gully
good length at middle and leg, defended to mid-off
over the wicket now to the left hander, pitches around off stump, defended on the back foot
nearly gets through with a fuller one which brings a drive, inside edge into his pads
big appeal for lbw, Nigel Llong says no. Not a bad shout. Straightened just a little. Took the front pad
a ripper! An unplayable googly...Sarfraz does very well to take it as it bounces up towards head height as it spits past Rankin's edge
squeezed out to short leg

another lbw appeal! And another not out. Again looked pretty straight, perhaps a better stride from Rankin this time. Very close. Pitched on leg stump. Looked to be heading that way, too. He nicks the leg bye, which Pakistan probably won't mind
over the wicket, full at off stump, defended
plays back, works with a hint of spin, turned off the pads behind square
round the wicket, a little short and wide, square drives and finds point
tighter to off stump, a good stride forward to defend
finds the edge this time, but it dies quickly and is well short of slip
a shorter delivery, driven off the back foot towards point
full outside off, and he's happy to let it go. The ball stays low as Sarfraz collects
raps his pads, but too high! Pitched on leg and went straight through. He missed the back-food defense, and the ball hit him above the knee roll
fuller on off, and he pushes at it off the front foot. Mistimed to cover point
good length on leg stump, and that's been clipped off his pads behind square. First runs after tea
full just outside off, and through his defense! Between bat and pad, and through to Sarfraz
full just outside off, and shaping away slightly. He shoulders his arms to see the over off

floated up outside off, and angling into Rankin. He tries to defend off the front foot, but the ball sneaks past his outside edge and hits his back leg. Big appeal for lbw, but turned down. That looked close, but the umpire suggests 'too high'
full on off, and defended off the front foot
good length outside off, and fended away towards the off side
good length on off, and worked off his pads to square leg. Man there
width offered outside off, but the ball spins into the left-hander. Mistimes his cut to point, and allows Wilson to get back on strike
full just outside off, and a bit of spin away from him. He rocks back and blocks it with soft hands
goes short! Forces Rankin to take his eyes off the ball and duck under the ball's line
full on middle, but angling into his pads. Tries to nudge it towards the leg side, but misses. Appeal for lbw again, but 'no' says the umpire. Would've probably gone down leg anyway
good length outside off, and pushes at it off the back foot. Takes an outside edge and creeps past the packed slip cordon. That's hundred for Ireland!
full on off, and once again hitting his front pad as Rankin misses the defense. Hits his back leg, but the appeal's soft. Because of an inside edge
good length on leg, and that's been clipped fine down the leg side! No one's there at fine leg, and Rankin moves on to 16
good length outside off, and his punch doesn't come off! Goes past his outside edge and through to the keeper
full just outside off, but spinning further away. Tries to drive but eventually pulls out of the shot
full outside off, and pushed off the front foot to sweeper cover. They walk across for the single

caught and bowled? Nope! Dropped. He's only got himself to blame. Full outside off, and the straight drive popped in the air. Shadab stuck both hands in front of his face, but the ball hits his palm and popped out
full outside off, but stays low! Does well to get bat to ball
lifted over the non-striker, but a fielder's manning the long on boundary. Full ball
flighted on middle, and turning into his pads this time! Well negated by tapping it towards the leg side
full just outside off, and driven to cover. Man there cleans up in a flash
good length outside off, and he lets it go through to Sarfraz
good length outside off, and punched off the back foot. Finds the fielder at cover once again
full just outside off, but angling into Rankin. Shuffles towards the delivery and blocks it back to Abbas
fuller on off, and forces the batsman to play at it. Driven back to the bowler off the front foot

good length outside off, and that's been inside edged! Nicely taken by Sarfraz, who had to run across to his right. Rankin tried to drive, but the ball zipped in, and then took a feather edge off the bat. Ireland lose their ninth
full on off, and swept off his toes to the leg side
tries the paddle, but doesn't come off! Tossed up on off, and he tries to lap it fine. Hits his toe instead, and the appeal for lbw is turned down
full on off once again. Big stride forward and fended back to Shadab
flighted on off, and he defends with soft hands. Played to point
full on off, and he comes walking down the wicket before defending towards the leg side
full on off, and that's been swept away! Keeps his eyes on the ball, and swings it square. Races away to the backward square boundary
good length just outside off, and left alone by Murtagh
good length outside off, but Murtagh goes onto his back foot and blocks it towards cover
short on off, and he's pulled this away! Played in front of square, and despite it coming off the bat's toe end, the shot has enough legs to find the boundary
good length outside off, and he backs away to try and cut it over the cordon. Fails to connect
edged over the cordon! Full on off, and he tries to drive it towards mid on. Induces the edge, but the ball goes over the three men at slip

full on off, and flicked to midwicket. They want a quick single, and Wilson's sliding effort saves him! But looks like he's slightly hurt. Shakes it off though. All good except for the dirt on his sweater
fancy! Reverse sweep. Full on off, and he's quick to change his grip and whip this past backward point
good length on off, and he rocks back to fend towards Shadab
full just outside off, and it's the wrong'un. But Wilson blocks it off the front foot. Eyes on the ball
cut past backward point! Just wide enough for Wilson to cut it away from his body. Backward point goes chasing after it, but that's futile
good length outside off, and turning away from him. Left alone
quicker one! Full on off, and gets onto his body early. Squeezes it away to midwicket though
good length on off, and blocked off the back foot. Shuffled across to the off side to get inside the line of the ball
fuller on off, and driven back to Abbas. Played with soft hands though
good length outside off, and shoulders his arms on this occasion. Too wide for Wilson to even bother engaging with
full outside off, and Wilson commits to the drive. Attempts the shot, but the ball zips in and goes past the bat's inside edge and through to Sarfraz. Could've easily taken the inside edge
tries to cut, but misses completely! Enough width offered outside off for Wilson to go chasing after it. Just can't connect though
full outside off, and slashes hard at it! Carves it over the man at gully, and that's four more for Ireland. Babar Azam did jump, but the ball was always going to go over him
worked off his pads to the leg side

they're all out! Clipped to short leg. It was a length ball on off, and his attempted whip behind square goes straight to Imam. Smiles all around among the visitors as Murtagh and Wilson make their way back. Ireland are bowled out for 130
full outside off, and shaping away from the left-hander. Joyce shoulders his arms
yorker on off, and Joyce gets behind the line of the ball. Blocks it away towards cover point

dropped? Nicked for certain, but did it carry? Full just outside off, but the ball shapes away slightly, and takes the outside edge. Drops in front of first slip, but definitely a chance for the keeper, because he stands slightly forward. Nervy start
good length on off, and he rocks back deep inside his crease. Defended back to Amir
shape! Perilously close to the outside edge of his bat. Good length outside off, and shaping away from Joyce. He tried to defend off the back foot, but the ball went past his outside edge
good length outside off, and punched towards cover off the front foot
good length outside off, and angling further away from Porterfield. Left alone
good length on off, and going across Porterfield once again. Happy to let it go
full on middle, and forces Porterfield to take a big stride forward. Defends it back to Abbas
good length on leg stump, and shaping across his bat's face. Porterfield goes onto the back foot and defends it towards the off side
good length on off, and angling away from him. Close to the outside of his front pad, but goes past it and through to Sarfraz
good length on off, and going away from the batsman. Two maidens to start off
good length outside off, but moving away after pitching. Joyce attempts to defend but keeps his bat inside the line's ball. Through to the keeper
good length on off, and this time it's angling into his body. Joyce shuffles, and clips it off his pads to square leg
full on off, and forces Joyce to go onto the back foot. It stayed low too, so he does well to get bat to ball
appeal for lbw! But the umpire's not interested. It was a good-length ball on middle and angling into his pads. Fails to whip it away towards the leg side
on off, and shaping into Joyce once more. Worked off his pads to square leg once again
full just outside off, and blocked towards the non-striker. Still no runs for Ireland
good length at off stump, probing away, defended to cover
and Ireland off the mark in their second innings, a positive drive from Porterfield as he reaches to a wide ball and places it through the covers
brings the line back to off stump, also not as full, defended with a slightly open face towards gully
holds the bat inside the line as this angles across him
gets forward to a fuller delivery and pushes square past point so Joyce is also off the mark, from his 15th delivery
comes round the wicket, full outside off, he's well forward and defends
full at off stump, searching for some swing with the new ball, driven firmly to mid-on
a length ball this time, angled in at the stumps, played with a slightly closed face towards midwicket
shorter and dragged wide outside off, comfortably left alone
beats the outside edge with a back-of-a-length delivery, some zip off the pitch and though Porterfield pulled the bat away pretty sure he played at that
dropped again! This time Porterfield gets the life. Another missed chance off Amir. Good length on off stump, shapes just enough to take the edge and that was pretty simple for Azhar at third slip
and now he gets one through the field, a fuller ball outside off, driven square past point
round the wicket, full outside off, left alone
top shot! Gets well forward into a full delivery and drives strongly through the covers
across the stumps and tucks a full delivery to mid-on
he's making an effort to move across his crease to cover any late movement, defends straight down the pitch
back over the wicket and pushes this one down the leg side
pushed across outside off, good length, Joyce holds the bat inside the line
short, down the leg side, goes for the pull without making contact
short outside off this time, Porterfield tries to play through the off side with a horizontal bat but just gets a bottom edge into the pitch
that's a lovely delivery! Late swing from just short of a good length and it curves past the outside edge. Being harsh, perhaps needs to be a touch fuller
this is fuller but also wider, left alone
booming late swing on this one, but again started a little too wide and it's left alone
short of a length outside off, climbs through at head height to Sarfraz but a pretty harmless delivery as was too wide
edged, but this one doesn't carry to second slip. Good length at off stump, Joyce a little caught on the crease, the nick dies
back of a length at off stump, defended to cover
outside off, a little short again, copped into the point area
nicely controlled stroke, opens the face to a good length ball outside off and steers it through backward point
round the wicket, full and straight, flicked to mid-on
