full, comes forward to drive and doesn't get much timing in the stroke. Dribbles back to Abbas
very full, some late swing, dug out to the off side
and again, targetted off stump this time with a very full length, not quite a yorker, jabbed to the leg side
dragged wide outside off, left alone
a little closer to off stump but then shapes away and Joyce is able to shoulder arms
short and wide, put away in style by Joyce as he stands tall and square cuts powerfully in front of point
now he overcompensates, goes very full outside off, Joyce gets onto the front foot and drives through the covers
over the wicket, good length outside off, left alone...a bit of wobble with that first ball
too short and that is also sent to the boundary, Porterfield stays just leg side of it and throws his hands through a back foot square drive
short again, another boundary, although a little less convincing this time as it flies off a top edge over the slips
a better length, fuller at off stump, defended back to the bowler
his eyes light up at a chance to take on another shortish delivery, opts for the pull but he misses and gets taken on the back leg
finally gets it full, outside off, left alone
short of a length outside off, the slips are appealing as it flies through to Sarfraz but that was nowhere near anything. Bizarre appeal!
on off stump, short of a length, hops into line and defends
flings this down the leg side, Sarfraz palms it away as he dives across so that's an extra to the total...Pakistan looking a little frustrated
full outside off, driven to mid-off
swings away outside off, left alone
a shorter delivery, Porterfield raises the bat high out of the line
full outside off, left alone, and he's overstepped. Tight one.
bit more zip on that delivery as he moves across Joyce from back of a length and is left alone
very similar delivery, doesn't move quite as much, Joyce watches it closely as it goes through
full at the stumps, defended
full at the stumps, onto the front foot and defended to cover
pushes a full delivery straight of mid-off who is able to get across but not in time to prevent the single
good length outside off, left alone
round the wicket, outside off, played with the turn into the leg side
big appeal as this spins quite sharply from the rough outside off, beats the inside edge and takes the front pad but he's well outside the line
worked towards short leg
fuller, he plays with his bat well in front of his pad this time
more nice spin from outside off, a lone appeal from him because Joyce is miles outside off stump
pushes this up fuller, driven off the inside part of the bat to the leg side. Probing start from Shadab who could have a lot of work in this innings
short of a length at off stump, defended to midwicket
strongly clipped off his pads down to long leg
well, well, that climbs considerably from just short of a length and Sarfraz takes it well above his head
and now there's some seam movement for him, back of a length, nips past the inside edge and takes his back leg
defended to the off side
almost drags this off the inside edge into the stumps, defending a length ball...encouraging over from Ashraf
back of a length, turns in towards leg stump, shuffles across and tucks this to deep square leg
looks to sweep, and that's a big lbw appeal from Shadab! Missed it completely, but he ensured he got a big stride across to it, so the impact was outside off stump
length ball outside off, bunted gently into the cover point region
floaty and full, dipping on middle and leg at almost yorker length. Misses the flick and the ball hits his pad, but that's probably slipping down leg. No appeal
tossed up wider outside off, stretches out to block into the covers
tossed up quite full, looking to pitch outside the left-hander's off stump and turn it back in, blocked back without any fuss. He's probably pitched this too full to really trouble the batsman
fullish, slanting across to off stump, defended to extra-cover
back of a length, slightly down leg. Shuffles across and looks to glance, but the shuffle ended up taking him too far from the line of the ball
in the blockhole on middle and off, blocked down to mid-off
full on middle stump, clipped to midwicket

length ball angling in towards off stump, a bit of inward movement to accentuate the angle as well. Presses forward to drive down the ground and the ball beats his inside edge and hits pad, outside the line of off though

good ball, this one angles into the fifth-stump channel and then straightens. Joyce plays away from his body in defence, but with soft hands, and the ball drops into the gap between second slip and gully and runs away for four
tossed up full on leg stump, clipped to midwicket
back of a length, turns in towards leg stump, tucked away to deep backward square leg
looks to sweep, and it's hit something and rolled away towards the fine leg boundary. Tossed up outside off, and I think he bottom-edged this. Ended up going way finer than he intended
short, wide, slapped away with ease to the cover point boundary
top-edges a full-toss angling down the leg side, but no worries, clears leg gully comfortably but lands well short of the man at long leg
flighty full-toss outside off, and Joyce brings up Ireland's 50 with a little jab towards backward point
good ball, draws Joyce forward to defend with his length and corridor line, and then gets it to straighten past his outside edge
this time he stays in his crease and gets behind the line to defend a similar delivery - with a bit of nibble away in the corridor - towards extra-cover
ooh, back of a length, a bit of inward seam, and some extra bounce too. Gets behind it to defend and it beats his inside edge and hits him high on the inner thigh
length ball angling into middle stump, clipped to midwicket
length ball in the fourth-stump channel, angling in from round the wicket. Joyce plays a flat-bat drive to mid-off
fullish, angling into off stump, driven to extra-cover
tossed up on a nice length outside off, and Porterfield stretches out to play a nice-looking paddle sweep to long leg
tossed up full and a fair way outside off, blocked into the point region
stays back to a length ball turning in from outside off, defends towards extra-cover
nice length, dangles it up a little wider outside off. Presses forward, lets it come on, and defends towards backward point
very full outside off, jabbed to mid-off
full outside off, defended to mid-off
full outside off, driven hard, along the ground, to mid-off
back of a length, a bit of inward movement from a fifth-stump line, but Porterfield watches it well and leaves it, secure in the knowledge that it won't hit his off stump
fuller, along the same channel, and this one leaves Porterfield and kicks up. Well left. The keeper takes it above his head
length ball outside off, left alone
there's the bouncer - outside off, though, and Porterfield ignores it

fullish now, angling into the fourth-stump channel and leaving Porterfield off the pitch. It's a beaut of a delivery, and it beats his attempted forward defensive. This is excellent bowling - pushed him back with the bouncer, and he was a little late getting on the front foot to this one
back of a length, angling into off stump, defended into the covers
back of a length, fifth-stump line, left alone. Now Sarfraz comes up to Amir for a chat. Put in a gully, Sarfy! Or a short leg!
tossed up outside off, gets forward and dabs with an open face, gently, into the point region to pick up one
tossed up on middle stump, defended to midwicket

nice length this time, a bit quicker on middle stump. Doesn't get forward quickly enough to defend, plays for a little more turn than was there, and it squirts away into the point region off the outside half of his bat
a touch shorter, on middle stump, goes back quickly to nudge towards square leg
Short, angling into the rib-cage, tucks it away nicely to long leg, keeps it down comfortably
back of a length outside off, punched to extra-cover
shortish on middle stump, gets on his toes to keep it down to midwicket
length ball on off stump, angling in from left-arm over, defended to mid-on
shortish, angling into leg stump, tucked off the hips to the right of long leg, far enough from the fielder to comfortably pick up two
fullish outside off, lets it come on and defends with soft hands towards point
back of a length, angling into off stump, gets behind it and blocks into the on side
length ball, a little wider outside off, left alone
length ball close to off stump, defended into the cover region
back of a length on off stump, defended back towards the bowler
ooh, lovely. Fullish outside off, and sharp inward movement off the seam thereafter, but it starts wide enough for Porterfield to leave with a certain degree of confidence. Good cricket all round
length ball, a little closer to off stump to start with. Pushes at it with slightly hard hands in defence, and the ball goes to midwicket off the inner half of the bat
back of a length outside off, jumps across and opens his bat face to pick up a single to third man
back of a length on middle stump, tucked away to the left of midwicket
full outside off, nice stride forward for the defensive push to mid-off
full, angling down leg, clipped to long leg. Rahat's line has been all over the place in this spell
length ball outside off, a bit of inward nip. Good stride forward to defend, and he gets a thick inside-edge into his pad
back of a length on off stump, gets back and across to block it back down the pitch
length ball angling into middle stump, tucked away to long leg
back of a length on off stump, jumps across to defend into the on side
length ball close to off stump, nice stride out to defend into the covers
back of a length, angling down leg, too far away from Porterfield for the tickle to fine leg, and Sarfraz has to dive to his right to stop it from running away for byes
full and fairly wide of off, goes into the drive too early, and the bottom hand kicks in to play that towards mid-off rather than into the covers as he intended
back of a length outside off, left alone
shortish, a bit of width, slashes at it and misses, playing too far away from his body without necessarily getting his back foot across
length ball, nips away slightly from a sixth-stump line. Joyce leaves it, playing a shadow-defensive a long way inside the line

fullish on middle and off, and he clips it to the left of mid-on and calls for a quick single in the last over of the day. Complete it comfortably, with Babar having to run across to pick up and throw with his right hand
length ball on off stump, defended to mid-off
full on off stump, and that's a lovely shot late in the day, a neat clip wide of mid-on. Good chase from Babar to dive and pull it back just short of the rope

and that is that, Ireland go to stumps without loss in their second innings. Back of a length in the corridor, a bit of shape away, and Joyce keeps a beady eye on it and leaves it, playing deliberately inside the line of the ball
tight line outside off,  but a judicious leave, just a little wary of the one bending back into off stump
fully onto the front foot and pushed firmly back to the bowler
good stride forward once again, that's been key to Ireland's batting in this innings so far, and an angled block into the cordon
attacking off stump with the angle across the left-hander, firmly blocked back down the pitch
stretching forward, looking for the drive but not quite there, pushed off a thick inside edge to the leg side
sweetly struck! Confidently forward, weight flowing through the line, and flashed away to the cover boundary. Top shot
outside off, steady pace and a touch of movement off the seam, left alone
through to the keeper once more with a yawning leave on the front foot
squeezed down into the deck, on the front foot once more, smothering the bounce from a good length
bat and pad tight together, pushed back down the pitch
stretching down the wicket, head over the ball. Solid
left alone outside off
sharper pace and movement away from the left-hander, left alone
big hooping swing on a toe-crushing length, Joyce watches it onto the middle of a clip to the leg side
very full once more, nice shape through the air, stabbed into the off side
aggressive length from Rahat, attacking the stumps with oodles of swing, Ireland need to be watchful as Joyce leans onto the front foot again
clipped to the leg side, they call the quick single and this is going to be tight! Pakistan are celebrating ... Faheem Ashraf gathered sharply at mid-on, released quickly, and Joyce is inches short!
on the back foot, dabbed into the off side
tucked to mid-on for a first touch of bat on ball
outside off, no stroke offered
pushed firmly back down the wicket, body behind the line
huge appeal and Balbirnie has a pair on debut! That was plumb alas, just planted the front foot, the ball nipped back off the seam, and Nigel Llong's slow death did the rest
passes harmlessly by the off stump
fully onto the front foot to defend
sliding down the leg side
very full once more, pushed with watchful intent into the leg side
good lift outside off stump, no stroke offered
on the hip, nurdled to the leg side, and that's well timed. Amir was the man at backward square leg, and to be frank, he doesn't look entirely mobile this morning...
pushed right back onto the stumps to defend, squared up a touch by the movement
more awkward lateral movement, just about negotiated with a good eye and late adjustment
onto the front foot, pushed back down the wicket
snorter! This one utterly explodes from a good length, bursting past the splice as O'Brien leans forward and jerks back!
good work from O'Brien, at first at least! A combative punch into the covers, seeking to escape the pair, but then a KP Red Bull run to the non-striker's end, a direct hit would have been miles out!
a flashing drive! Looks more handsome that it actually is, a touch sliced on impact, but good intent from the skipper
outside off, plugging away on a nagging length
stretching onto the front dog, reaching as far down the pitch as he can, and blocked to the leg side
through to the keeper with more shape through the air
outside off, through to the keeper as O'Brien hauls his bat inside the line

good grief, how did Porterfield survive that?! A jab down into the crease from O'Brien, an instant call for a single, no response from the striker, a collision with the fielder as they converge on the ball, then a desperate dive back to the crease! The shy comes in but is fumbled by Ashraf with the stumps at his mercy!
slashed murderously up and over third man! Well, why not, it's all gone haywire out there!
clipped down to backward square
pushed right back onto the stumps to block right under the eyeline
big nip across the left-hander from a leg-stump line, squeezed to the off side
blocked from deep in the crease
outside off, no stroke offered
thwacked on the thigh pad, good nip off the seam
outside off, well left, keeping the bat well out of harm's way
on the back foot, pushed into the covers
good shape straight away. Outside off and curving towards the cordon
sharp pace from back of a length, tucked to the leg side
outside off, and through to the keeper
edged, but safe, all along the ground to third man. Good length from Amir but Porterfield was over the ball in his shot
shuffling onto the back foot, and punched through the gap at backward point
outside off, and through to the keeper
a bit of a chancy hoick from off stump through square leg. Looking for the cover drive but onto it too soon
sharp bouncer! O'Brien climbs into a pull but the ball is through him before his bat can enter the fray
full face of the bat this time, meeting the angle from round the wicket
soft-handed defence into the cordon, meeting that one on the back foot
width, and slapped fiercely through point! That'll cheer the Irish up
tapped off the hips to short midwicket
stunning delivery! Bending into off stump, nipping away, bursting past the edge! That's perfection, everything but the nick
beaten again, through to the keeper on a fractionally shorter length
on the back foot. Blocked back down the pitch
through to the keeper, slightly wider line, angling into the left-hander
beats the edge with angle into the bat and nip away. He's banging out a threatening length, but he looks very uncomfortable between balls
very full to finish, right up to the toes, and dug into the off side
on the pads to start, tapped to the leg side
tossed up, right onto the toes, clipped to mid-on
nudged to the leg side
back of a length, slow turn from over the wicket to the left-hander, met on the back foot with a tap to the leg side
much slower through the air, leg-stump line once more
lots of air to finish, dipping late on the crease and blocked to cover
stabbed into the covers and finds the gap for the second run
on the back foot, fenced to point
defended on the back foot, and pushed back down the pitch, tight lines once again from Amir
fenced to short cover, pushed back into the crease again, Amir just pulling his length back a touch in this over
full length this time, only one slip now, as Amir attacks the off stump and is met with a full face of the bat
stands tall on the back foot and blocked
round the wicket, a bit of a loopy pie this time, but O'Brien resists having a wild hack and pats the full toss to cover
striding forward and blocked to cover
wider line and sharper turn, but O'Brien is equal to it on the front foot
big turn and raps the pad! Shadab was very very excited about that, but Nigel Llong reckons that was doing too much. Probably right on balance
up on the toes to defend on the back foot
stabbed out to cover
another appeal for lbw as Porterfield plays across the line to a full delivery but that's just angling down the leg side
and another shout! Height the issue this time, it's a back of a length delivery which nips back and catches him on the crease
length ball outside off, left alone
full again, swinging in late and deflects off the pads to square leg
back of a length at off stump, defended
targetting off stump, perhaps kept down a fraction, defended
short of a length, worked to the leg side
this is a little fuller, starts a touch wider outside off as well and spins in at O'Brien
tucked off the stumps towards short leg
this turns from outside off into the pads, worked off the legs to backward square leg
pushed up fuller, he thrusts his bat forward to block
inside edge on this one as he plays forward to a full delivery, flies quickly past short leg...not sure it was a chance although Imam looks frustrated under the lid. Dropped short
short of a length outside off, cut into the pitch and it bobbles to the off side
fuller, at off stump, played with a straight bat to mid-off
straight at off stump, O'Brien back in his crease, defends to the bowler
outside off, back of a length, defended with an open face to backward point

cleaned him up! Two stumps out of the ground - off and middle - what a sight for a fast bowler. A full delivery, a hint of late shape in at O'Brien, he aims to whip it through the leg side and his woodwork is shattered. The ball didn't do that much, so O'Brien will be disappointed to miss it. Decent pace, though
pushed across outside off on a good length, left alone
full outside off, a stride forward and he defends
and again, gets across outside off with a good stride
starts this too straight and it spins down the leg side
nicely bowled, back outside off, targeting the rough, a touch of bounce and it takes the splice but down in front of short leg
tucked off the pads behind square on the leg side...he finally moves off 31
driven to the off side
that's a beauty! Climbs from back of a length outside off and skims past the outside edge...continues to lift through to Sarfraz who takes it in front of his face
a little fuller, defended towards point
beaten again! With a fuller delivery this time. He's stretching forward and the delivery holds its line

taken this time! They've grabbed a catch off Amir. This is a lovely spell. In the channel again, full outside off, Porterfield reaches forward and gets an outside edge. Sarfraz dives to his left in front of first slip to gather it
full at middle and leg, worked off the pads to long leg
full outside off, pushed firmly into the covers and they decline to run after a fumble. Sensible
well bowled! So close to the edge and being bowled. Full at off stump, spins to beat the bat and the timber. Sarfraz doesn't glove it
gets forward and blocks tentatively to cover
nearly pushes this to short leg! Drifts into the pad and, in fact, not sure there's bat involved
flicked to the leg side
pushes a full delivery off the front foot into the covers
strong shot! Tossed up outside off, O'Brien strides forward and plays a thumping drive wide of mid-off
slashed away square of the wicket, just a hint of width outside off, stand and deliver from Stirling as he throws his hands through a square drive which flies behind point
tighter to off stump, good length, pushed to point
on middle and off, defended
a touch fuller, at middle and off, trapped between bat and pad as he plays forward
short of a length, for a second looked like Stirling was shaping for an attacking shot through the leg side but opted to defend in the end
attempts a yorker at off stump, dug out to backward point
full at off stump, worked to mid-on
short of a length and pulled over the leg side, a short-arm jab through midwicket. Well picked up
full outside off, onto the front foot and drives to the right of point
back of a length, some movement in at Stirling, takes a thick inside half of the bat and drops down by his feet
full outside off, left alone
good length outside off, defended to cover
tossed up, it's a low full toss in the end, clipped to mid-on
shorter, a googly, defended on the back foot
fuller, at the stumps, takes an inside edge as he plays forward and runs to backward square
full at middle and off, a leg-break, defended on the front foot
shorter, flatter, he goes onto the back foot and drives to deep cover...good use of the crease

big appeal for lbw! He didn't pick the googly. Spins back in from a good length, beats the inside edge. Perhaps a touch too much bounce? Shadab not impressed. Struck the back leg. He had a big stride in
that's wild swing, miles away from his body, at a delivery very wide outside off. Nearly edged it
short of a length outside off, defended to point
full and straight, clipped out to deep square leg
short of a length outside off, defended at the top of the bounce to the covers
left alone outside off
goes for the off-stump yorker and it's nicely driven through the covers
pushes a full delivery back to the bowler
wider outside off, full, driven to cover
a wrong 'un, defended to the leg side
misreads the length this time, plays back to quite a full delivery and the ball takes the inside edge into his back pad
gets forward to a full delivery and flicks into midwicket
drags this down short outside off, cut to deep point
full outside off, drives through backward point to the sweeper
well bowled! This moves away late from a full length and beats the outside edge although O'Brien could have left it alone
fuller, closer to off stump, driven to deep point
good length at off stump, defended on the front foot
a touch shorter, he's still keen to get on the front foot, defends from high on the bat
defended into the leg side
full on middle, defended on the front foot
full at the stumps, pushed firmly to the man under the helmet
stretches forward on off stump and defends
short outside off, bit of width, he rocks back and drives wide of the cover sweeper
low full toss outside leg stump, clipped along the ground to midwicket
full at middle, is well forward and defends
full at off stump, he comes forward to drive, skews off a thick outside edge but into the ground towards backward point...good save by Shafiq
good length at off stump, defended
full outside off, left alone
at off stump, onto the front foot, defended
a short ball, angled in at the body, rolls his wrists and pulls to long leg
short again, on leg stump, this hook is not quite as well controlled but flies safely towards long leg
short of a length, played off the back foot
very full, a yorker, dug out to the leg side
a length ball, straight, think a googly, tapped to the leg side
short outside off, cut to deep point
short on the pads, clipped straight to short leg
huge appeal for lbw! Another googly and it's done too much. Pitched around middle and would have drifted past leg stump
length ball at off stump, defended on the front foot
angled in at middle and off, worked into midwicket
attempts a drive on the up outside off, ball wasn't that full, beats the top edge...not a percentage stroke
this one ducks in quite late, on a good length, pushed to the covers
trapped off the inside edge into the leg side
full at off stump, gets well forward and defends with a high left elbow to mid-off
a little too short, allows him onto the back foot and punches to deep cover
gets right across his stumps and sweeps quite a full delivery, doesn't come out of the middle, loops wide of short leg
big appeal for lbw as he sweeps again! Another not out. No bottom edge but he got outside the line
full and straight, tapped back down the pitch
shorter, a googly, tucked wide of short leg
full at middle, defended

given lbw, umpire says pad before bat!. A big inswinger from Abbas (reverse swing?), on a good length, tails into Stirling and, yes, that looks an excellent decision by Nigel Llong. Struck the knee roll just before the bat came through. Perhaps not a decision we'd have seen in a pre-DRS era (I know there's no DRS this match, but umpires now think differently)
more late shape but this is sliding down the leg side as it glances off the pad
full at off stump, defended to point
good length outside off, good carry to the keeper
full and straight, pushed into midwicket
full outside off, defended to cover...a testing over from Abbas
plays back and pushes to the off side, wants to get him forward
full at middle and leg, he opens his stance a touch and drives into the covers
again a little too short, tapped to deep cover off the back foot
full at middle and leg, leans forward and pushes into space on the off side
over the wicket, full outside off, defended
beats the outside edge by one that spins nicely
full at off stump, blocked on the front foot
a short ball and it's pulled along the ground to deep square leg
full and straight, hint of late movement on that one, defended to mid-on
left alone outside off
finds the outside edge with a full out which he leans forward into, but played with soft hands and it scoots along the ground wide of second slip
straight, nearly plays around his front pad but blocks it safely down the pitch
a googly, back of a length, defended to the on side
tossed up full at off stump, driven to deep cover
a flick of the wrists against this full one so he can place it wide of cover
nicely bowled, beats him with a leggie which gripped outside off. KOB feeling for it
this is fuller, he gets a good stride in and drives to long-off
short of a length, whipped over midwicket with a short-arm pull
this nips back off a good length, beats the inside edge and takes him high on the back leg
full outside off, driven firmly to cover
length outside off, played with an open face towards point
full at off stump, played back to the bowler
keeps landing on the spot, good length just outside off, defended to cover
fuller, at the stumps, clipped out to deep square leg
pushed across full outside off, left alone
nearly drags this on! Just feeling for a good length delivery away from his body, the inside edge scoots past the stumps to fine leg
left alone, reaches Sarfraz at chest height from a full length
back of a length outside off, punched square of the wicket through point
fuller and wider outside off, doesn't quite get his timing on the drive and finds mid-off
full at off stump, defended
full outside off, left alone
full at off stump, gets forward and pushes to cover
short of a length, he starts to come forward then rocks back, plays it late with a straight bat towards gully
full and straight, defended
fuller, a slower ball outside off, he opens the face and nudges through point
a low full toss down the leg side, he takes advantage with a clip off his pads and beats long leg...rare loose ball from Abbas
steers a full delivery outside off to deep point
a bouncer over off stump, he goes for the pull but doesn't make contact...then shadows a ramp to third man
another bouncer, reasonably sharp, over middle and off and just shapes back at O'Brien as he sways out of the line
back of a length, takes an inside edge into his pads and bobbles to the off side
full outside off, defended to point
on the pads, worked wide of mid-on
over the wicket, good length, takes the inside half of the bat
outside off, good length, pushed to cover
defended with an open face to backward point, the way he played that suggested it kept a little low
angled across outside off, left alone
round the wicket, full outside off, left alone
back of a length outside off, pushed to cover
good length outside off, a controlled outside edge down to third man
short outside off, he sways out of the line
driven off the back foot through point
again it's short outside off, he stays back and drives square to deep point
straighter delivery, back of a length, defended to the leg side
gets this one fuller and brings a touch of uncertainty as Wilson tries to get forward, takes an inside edge into his boot
round the wicket, full outside off, leans forward and defends to mid-on
that's loose from KOB, short of a length outside off and he feels for it away from his body. Might have reversed away a touch
gets forward to a full delivery and drives to cover, takes the run on the misfield
full at off stump, defended
edged, taken at the wideish slip! And 100 Test wickets for Amir Wilson lured into a drive away from his body, full outside off, the thick edge is safely held
over the wicket, and beats the left-handed Thompson first ball, playing a little away from his body...the ball scuttles through to Sarfraz
full and wide, he chases it with a drive which comes off the bottom of the bat to the cover sweeper
short of a length at off stump, worked to the leg side
fuller, at off stump, played to point
back of a length outside off, angled down to third man
full outside off, driven to cover
gets forward and pushes out to deep point so he keeps the strike
round the wicket, length ball at off stump, flicked to deep midwicket
squirts a drive off a thick outside edge wide of point
full at the stumps, just a touch too leg side, clipped off the pads to deep square
full, wide outside off, good stride and a solid drive to deep cover
full and straight, clipped firmly to mid-on and they scamper a pretty tight single
angled across and left alone outside off
banged in short, doesn't get up much. Ducked
stands tall on the back foot and pumps a back-of-a-length delivery straight back down to the line to be gathered in Rahat's followthrough
solid defence, right behind the line of off stump
banged in short, an bit of an ungainly swipe, not really in control of the pull, but gets away with it. Onto him too quickly
firmly thumped out to deep cover, not a lot of footwork, very sharp eye for the line and length

edged, and just short of the diving keeper! A regulation nick to a lifter on off stump, but it was always heading down, so Sarfraz ended up sprawling at first slip's feet... EDIT: I think that did carry actually. A tough chance but a drop all the same
cracked with intent out to deep cover
short and sharp, a bit of a standing duck-sweep from Thompson, not quite lining up the length, and playing the stroke as a form of evasive action
onto the front foot with more surety this time, pumped to mid-off
inswinging full toss, and that's a fine flick through the leg side. Sizing up the angle and helping it on its way. The deficit is into single figures...
back of a length and width too, creamed out to the fringe of the cover boundary. A long chase as they come back for the third
through to the keeper, outside off, angled across the right-hander
floated outside off and pressed to cover
solidly onto the front foot to block
dangled outside off from round the wicket, dabbed back down the pitch
turning towards the front pad, patted to the leg side
looped up, dipping late on an off-stump line. Blocked
well bowled again, just back of a length, turning in, obliging Thompson to mind his stumps
brisk wicket-to-wicket line, onto the front foot and defended to the leg side
nip off the seam, on a good length, and slapping into the top of the pads, too high for the lbw but a very good line
tapped to the leg side, and a sharp single
outside off, pushed to cover
pushed to the off side
inside-edged drive, through square leg. They all count. Ireland trail by 1!
tapped back down the pitch
tossed up above the eyeline and calmly patted into the covers
solidly forward, finding the middle of the bat again with another measured push
much fuller length, dug out with the toe of the bat
head right over the ball, sniffing the leather in a smothering forward defence
leaning out of the crease, tucking the ball to the leg side
on the back foot, flinched to the leg side
dangled outside off, and Thompson is tempted into an injudicious slash. Misses out, luckily for him
flashed aggressively into the covers, and a huge cheer for Ireland levelling the scores!
edged but safe as houses! Clean through the vacant second slip, and well, that's what you get for being over-cautious in a dominant position
fully forward, pushed into the covers
very full length, met with a fuller face, pushed to the off side
padded away
round the wicket, O'Brien shuffles back to wear this on his pad too
big spin! Rips across KOB's torso and straight into the hands of slip!
clipped with intent off the toes, a low full toss, but straight to midwicket. A missed freebie
flicked to the leg side, and Kevin O'Brien scores Ireland's first Test half-century!
banged in short, way too short! Sarfraz can't intercept that!
up on the toes, pushing urgently down to long on
absolutely clattered, the shot of the day, but so arrow-straight that it smashes the non-strikers' middle stump clean out of the ground!
full length, and flogged back down the pitch with an arcing swing of the bat. No great timing but plenty intent
short and pulled out to deep square leg
clipped firmly off the pads
hauled out to deep backward square leg
floated up and driven to short cover, where a slight misfield offers a chance for a run. Declined
pushed out to cover
on the back foot, dabbed to the off side
an ambitious appeal as Thompson sweeps, but he's struck outside the line
head over the ball, solid block
lots of air, calmly driven down to long-off
thumped into the covers
outside off and that's loose! A flat-footed poke, following the outswing. Careful...
drilled on the up to point
solidly forward to block
cracked into the covers on the front foot once more
back of a length, tailing into the pads, tucked to the leg side
crashed into the covers from round the wicket
over the wicket to the left-hander, pushed firmly back to the bowler
full length, threatening to turn, and solidly blocked on the front foot
half an appeal, struck on the pad but looked like it was turning down the leg side
beauty! A quicker wrong'un, zipping onto a good length and bursting past a confused edge
blocked to complete the over
fully forward and blocked back down the pitch
forward and blocked back down the pitch
instant nip from a full length, cannons off the thigh pad and they steal the single
an elegant wallop into the covers, just back of a length and enough width to free the arms. Gathered in the covers
up on the toes, and pushed into the covers
flashy, flashy! Outside off, a hard-handed drive, but the ball just ghosts off the seam and through to the keeper
tight line on leg stump, swinging back in and rapping the pad. Doing too much but an awkward line
banged in short, up onto the toes, worked to the leg side
firmly blocked back down the wicket
through to the keeper once more
outside off, a flinch from Thompson as the ball climbs past the edge. He's cross with himself for that shot
outside off, keeps low as Thompson leaves well alone this time
tapped to the leg side, walking across the crease to close the face on his stroke
chiselled off the toes, and that's a lovely piece of timing! Rolled the wrists on impact and pinged the ball through square leg!
outside off, through to the keeper, a bit of shape back into the right-hander
flicked again, and Ireland pass 200! Misdirected into the toes, and tapped very fine. Runs flowing against the harder new nut!
leaning forward and pushed to the off side
another single to finish a productive over, a hint of width and worked behind square on the off side
on the back foot and blocked
through to the keeper, tight line and no stroke
seaming away from back of a length and once again Thompson is living dangerously outside off
a firm clip to the leg side, good strike rotation
angled across the right-hander, tapped to the off side
edged, and wide of the diving second slip! It's more runs in the end, but it's come from a genuine nick. Outside off, climbing off the seam, Amir did everything right there
firmly blatted up to mid-off. Solid connection on the front foot
outside off, left alone with a yawning raise of the blade
defended from the crease, laying the bat in the line of the ball
thumped in the air, but in front of the man at point! That works well enough ... more runs to the cause!
doughty defence straight back down the line of the ball, and that will be tea
on a good length at off stump, defended
this nips back from short of a good length, but started on a middle and leg line so just clatters into the thigh guard
back outside off stump, good length, defended
short of a length, he stays back and angles down to third man with an open face
full outside off, he drives and it skews off the inside edge to deeps square
back of a length, played to the off side...quiet start after tea
edged, did that carry to second slip? Swing from a full length, wide outside off, Thompson feels for it. Escapes through the fielder - Shafiq - and scoots to third man. Was short of him
more swing, full outside off, he chases it with a drive which flies off a thickish outside edge over backward point
he's going for it! A half volley outside off, he watches it swing, leans forward and drives it along the ground through the covers
drags the length back, wide outside off, Thompson playing his shots as he flays at this and is beaten over the top edge
short outside off, gets over the top of it and angles down to third man
gets this one full at off stump, some late swing back, O'Brien keeps it out to the leg side
he's driving again, gets a stride forward and plays beautifully through the line and finds the gap at cover
back of a length, defended to point
fuller, wide outside off, this time the drive finds the man at cover...good fun, this
big appeal for lbw as this nips back and takes him on the back leg, given not out and by the time Amir turns back around the ball as flown past Sarfraz to the boundary. Too high for the shout
fuller, at off stump, defended...Amir grimaces in his follow through
good length at off stump, defended to mid-off
full outside off, swings in a touch, driven to mid-off
back of a length, straight, worked to the right of mid-on
good length outside off, defended to point
a very short bouncer which is angled down the leg side, and it's too short
he tries to leave this alone, a good length delivery outside off, but is late withdrawing the bat and it rolls off the face towards second slip
a straight delivery is worked wide of mid-on
huge appeal for lbw, looks good, but not out! Nigel Llong indicates he hit it! Full length, pitched on, swung back nicely. Had to be bat. Well, I'm not sure he hit it
full at the stumps, tucked through midwicket
round the wicket now, angled in at the stumps, worked to deep square leg
short over off stump, he lets it go through
well bowled, this climbs sharply from a good length and moves away to beat Thompson's drive. Sarfraz takes it above his head
full at off stump, defended to the cover ring
another drive proves productive for Thompson, very nicely guided behind backward point and third man can't cut it off
good length outside off, pushed to cover
sweetly timed off his pads, waits for it to swing and flicks to deep square leg
a very short bouncer and again it's called wide
drags this short outside off, cut into the covers
that's a good one, gets it on the right line, just outside off, with a hint of movement away to beat the edge
a lovely piece of timing off the back foot as he drives between point and cover
fuller, swings away outside off, as does Thompson and doesn't make contact this time
defended to the off side
gets forward to a fuller delivery outside off, slides off the face through backward point
nearly bowls him with one that just shapes back enough from outside off to beat the booming drive
this one nips back off the seam from short of a length and takes Thompson on the pads
fuller, late swing in at the left hander, clipped to mid-on
what a ripper! He's bowled well today. This is on a good length outside off, then climbs sharply past the outside edge
full and a bit too straight, clipped off the pads to long leg
full outside off, swings away, left alone
once again into a terrific position to drive as he slots this to mid-off
good length outside off, left alone
full at middle and off, defended
another one through to the keeper
touch short, bunted back to the bowler
defended on the back foot
rocks back and square drives another short one out to deep cover
round the wicket, full and straight, defended on the front foot
shorter, allows him on the back foot to defend
that's better, fuller and in the rough, spins back and beats the inside edge to take the front pad
pushed across wide outside off, left alone
strides forward then leaves alone a full delivery
a straighter delivery, too much on the pads, worked out to deep square leg...more applause as the 250 comes up. Daring to dream?
full at off stump, squeezed off the inside part of the bat to mid-on
short outside off but he gets away with thanks to a sharp stop in the gully to intercept the square cut
a bouncer that doesn't get up that much and only just passes over Thompson's back as he ducks
angled into the pads and neatly tickled away through short fine leg...no one is stopping that, score keeps ticking over
onto off stump, he leans forward and defends
fuller still, dead-batted into the vacant silly point area
this spins away quite sharply outside off, left alone at the last minute
full at off stump, pushes forward with bat and pad together into the covers
spins away outside off and he doesn't play
terrific shot! Super way to bring up a fifty and the hundred stand. Latches onto a short ball outside off and swings it wide of mid-on with a crisp pull
fuller, at off stump, defended
full, on the pads, clipped to long leg
short of a length at off stump, defended down by his feet
back of a length at leg stump, deflects off the thigh pad into the leg side
short of a length, gets inside the line and works it off his body to deep square
full outside off, tapped to cover
good length, a little wider outside off, Thompson steps across and defends
a low full toss driven to the right of mid-off, may feel he missed out there
works a straight ball to midwicket
short outside off, cut to deep point
over the wicket to the left hander, full and straight, defended
beats the edge as O'Brien gets a little loose with this drive, Abbas straight onto a full length outside off
good length outside off, defended
gets away with this, driving loosely again, away from his body, flies off a thick outside between backward point and gully
full and straight, driven back to the bowler
defended to mid-off
full at the stumps, a hint of movement, plays with a straight bat
a googly outside off, stretches forward and defends
that's nicely bowled, a touch slower, full outside, draws a thick edge but things are running Ireland's way and runs down to third man
very full outside off and this time he drives sweetly through cover, wide of long-off
round the wicket, pitches outside leg but O'Brien opts to defend with the bat
strong sweep from leg stump, and a good piece of fielding at deep square leg to prevent the boundary
plays away from his body at a delivery tossed wider outside off, gets beaten and has to be careful not to drag his back foot out of the crease
drives on the up to mid-off
that's a ripper! Jeepers, how did that miss? Good length, nips back miles off the seam, beats the inside edge and travels over middle and off
and this one goes the other way, this is classy bowling. Pitches around the same spot, maybe a fraction wider, and moves away past the outside edge of O'Brien's poke
a touch shorter outside off, angled to gully
full at off stump, defended
gets a small stride into this one, defends to point. A very good over
round the wicket, very full, pushed to cover
that's done it! Shadab pulls out a ripper to break the stand. Pitches in the rough outside off, grips sharply, beats the inside edge and takes middle stump. That spun miles
solidly into line
punched into the off side
big turn, and left alone outside off
stretching forward to drive on the up. The breakthrough over, and how Pakistan needed that!
forward on the off stump and tapped to the leg side, and sure enough, he trusts his team-mate to hold up an end
squared up on the off stump, and blocked
outside off, and no stroke once more as Abbas plugs away on a tight line
very full, shaping to leg and straightening a touch, Kane is forward uneasily, a bit of an lbw candidate as he chisels this down the pitch
more nip back off the seam and Kane has to be on his mettle here, an inside-edged drive back to the bowler
width, and cut to deep backward point
poking forward, a very big stride but still slapped on the knee-roll, but outside the line
dead-batted defence from deep in the crease
pushed right back onto the stumps and there's more urgency among the Pakistan fielders now
stretching onto the front foot, pushed stoutly back to the bowler
another loud appeal as Kane doesn't pick the wrong'un! Slapped on the pad, was still on the move as he did so, but maybe too high
head over the ball, solid defence
firmly forward, blocked into the covers
open-faced dab to gully, hanging back in the crease
a loose waft! Feeling for the shot that wasn't quite there. Through to the keeper with oohs all round
inside-edged drive, and KoB moves into the 90s!
outside off, no stroke there
tapped to mid-off
turn from outside leg, tapped behind square for a comfortable single
biffed back to the bowler, who dives to his right to intercept
defended on the line of off stump
round the wicket, looped onfo a full length, and stabbed with an open face out to point
leaning forward and blocked down the track
sliding on, the googly, but more or less picked and squeezed to the leg side
banged in short, and safely ducked
big nip off the seam but much too high, awkwardly tucked up nonetheless and struck in the midriff
outside off, seaming away, no stroke offered
through to the keeper once more
swinging down the leg side, and gathered by the keeper. Sounded like a flick off the pad as it went
crashed through the covers! A resounding cheer goes up as Ireland take their lead into three figures! Leaning through the width and taking full toll!
fully forward, blocked to the off side as Shadab turns it out of the rough
a misfield and four more! Freebies in the 90s... maybe it's his day after all! A solid sweep, but a fumble at backward square
head over the ball and blocked to the leg side
big turn from outside leg, but short enough for KoB to step back and place his pushed drive into the gap at mid-on
flicked to the leg side
keeps low outside off stump, and skids into a slightly loose back-foot swat
worked to the leg side
pokey and loose! Outside off and climbing off the seam. Avoids the nick though which is all that matters
full length, angled into the right-hander, stoutly blocked on off stump
leg-sided, flicks the pad and they jog through to bring KoB back on strike
is this the hundred... It's flicked down the leg side, it's rolled to the rope ... but it's come off the pad! A huge cheer turns to a groan as the umpire flexes his knee. Boo
solid on the off stump, forward in defence. The wait goes on...
twirly length outside off stump, no stroke as the ball tweaks past
slashed with intent into the covers, a bit of a tight run at the non-striker's end, but safe in the end
ooh, that is a teasing delivery to a biffer in the 90s... right up above the eyeline, have a go if you dare. KoB is in the zone though ...
faster and flatter, pushed to cover with a loud 'wait on!'
huge appeal, and a very woody noise! Is there a nick? No, says the umpire! Bat on ground maybe? Cripes!
tapped to the off side to keep the strike and, more importantly, move one closer...
very cute little dab through third man... he's on 99 ...
pushed onto the back foot and squeezed into the covers
pushed to the off side... no way through there
outside off and through to the keeper, angling back into the stumps but well enough judged
outside off once more, left alone once more. Kane playing a vital supporting role now, he's settled after a dicey start
blocked into the off side, closing the door on another stump-to-stump delivery
tight line, back of a length, dabbed to the off side
yikes, he's dangled his bat at that one! Looked to the naked eye like a nick, but it was just Amir's angle away from the bat

there it is! Kevin O'Brien is Ireland's maiden Test centurion! Reaches it with a squirt through point ... not the most dignified stroke, but he finds the gap and who cares how, it's how many! A pump of the fist, he knew immediately, then off comes the helmet to salute a jubilant Malahide. What a moment!
solidly onto the front foot, composing himself once more
fenced to the leg side, riding the bounce
outside off, and through to the keeper
this one pops from a good length, but he rides it out
much fuller length, dug out by the toes
swinging into the pads, and there's more freebies, a flick off the legs and away through fine leg. Up comes Ireland's 300! They were 7 for 4 in the first innings!
solidly blocked on off stump
back of a length, pushed into the off side
full once more, and clipped off the toes
aggressive intent, back of a length, and dropped at the toes
big hooping inswing, a change of angle to round the wicket, and he didn't get much behind the line of that one
meeting the fuller length on the front foot
a huge appeal as Kane kneels into a wafty drive! But the noise might have been bat on turf once more. Umpire is unmoved
pushed to mid-off on the front foot. A maiden over, but Ireland march on
pushed back onto the stumps and flinched to the leg side
banged in short, wide of off stump, through to the keeper
outside off, no stroke once more. Ireland looking composed now, just soaking in the occasion really, and why not. Where else would these two rather be?
inswinger on leg stump, thuds the pad but sliding down
nipping back off the seam and blocked
down the leg side, misdirected but a good diving stop from Sarfraz
another big appeal! Crashed on the pad and did that pitch on leg? Yes, reckon so, but it's going over the top as KoB hops back into his crease
firmly punched into the covers
solidly onto the front foot once more
banged in short, Kane ducks as the ball swings down the leg side
dangled outside off stump, just about gets away without playing at that one
through to the keeper, but zipping through the defences first. Didn't know much about that one!
beautiful inswinging yorker! But that's an impressive response, watching it onto the middle of a clip to deep midwicket. KoB is seeing it like a planet!
inside-edged, but clear of the keeper! Wow, when you're hot, you're hot. That passed straight over the top of middle stump on its way to the rope. They all count!
driven, but without conviction, almost on the walk. He's suddenly looking a little bit tired against a probing bowler
that's a shot with more conviction! A down-on-one-knee square drive, out to deep point
on the back foot, punched into the covers
through to the keeper once more, good pace and carry at this late stage of the day
clipped to the leg side, gathered in the deep
uppishly cracked out to point, and Shadab looks like he's dropped this! Another drop off Amir, but to be fair it was a run-saving effort too, at full stretch to his left
squeezed into the cordon
nipping off the seam, hopping across the crease, worked to the leg side with aplomb
fully onto the front foot and pushed back down the ground
angled into the pads from round the wicket. Kane misses out on a clip to leg
sliding down the leg side
firmly forward on an off-stump line. Blocking the life out of the ball
on the pads, and tucked urgently out to deep midwicket
inswing on a full length, but gentle pace and easily watched back down the pitch
cracked fiercely out to point, but excellent fielding from Imam to cut off the runs
firmly onto the front foot, and poked back down the pitch
nearly! Outside off, jabs down late, and the ball trickles back past the stumps
late on it once again! Very full, very straight, and quite quick enough for this time of night. O'Brien looks like a man who needs to put his feet up
edged and safe! Wow, you could have scripted that. Just the one slip, and it flies through the vacant second! A zombified poke from O'Brien, and so nearly paid the price. Instead, more runs!
wafted out to point, as Sarfraz closes the stable door with an overdue second slip
through to the keeper, Kane does well to keep inside the line
lifts off the seam, through to the keeper
outside off, swinging away, through to the keeper again
wicket to wicket line, with a big shadow looming across the pitch. Blocked to the leg side
so close! O'Brien jabs down late, the ball rolls inexorably towards the stumps... and just sneaks past by a splinter! Zoinks!
massive appeal! Zippy wicket to wicket line, slaps the pad as it stays low, and that's plumb, surely? NO! Umpire Llong heard an inside edge, and KoB survives!
firmly forward, head over the ball
zips straight through the gate, stays low, and beats the outside edge of the off stump! Not sure how he's managed it, but Kevin O'Brien has made it to the close despite being on his chinstrap!
pushed onto the back foot from round the wicket, and defended
round the wicket once more, through to the keeper once more
on the back foot, tapped out to deep cover, and up comes the 50 partnership. And a tremendous support role from Kane in all that
through to the keeper once again, ploughing a tight furrow outside off
nip off the seam, back into the pads, big movement but no danger of the lbw
left alone once more

width, slashed, gone! O'Brien is gone to his first ball of the morning! He forgot that he wouldn't necessarily still be seeing it like a planet today, and his feet weren't moving either. Big outswing, he lined up the mow through the covers but snicked it straight to slip!
on the pads, flicked to the leg side
on the pads, flicked to the leg side
lining it up outside off and left alone
through to the keeper again, good discipline from Kane, who is fundamental to Ireland's hopes now
beauty! Wider line, back of a length, angling in, through to the keeper once again. An overstep spoils the overall effect
angled into the legs, tucked around the corner
width outside off, nipping off the seam, and through to the keeper
on the pads, flicked down the leg side
through to the keeper from over the wicket, tight lines again
fuller length, dug in towards the off stump, squeezed to point
keeps low outside off, no need to play at that
tucked to the leg side, very tight line
outside off, climbing through to the keeper with extra nip off the seam
tighter line, lifting off the seam, more good judgement from Kane who is refusing to rush here
firmly behind the line of the ball, dabbed out to cover
wider line, keeps lower through to the keeper, still no shot in anger
ploughing a good furrow outside off stump, nipping through to the keeper - definite evidence of variable bounce this morning, but none of it on a stump-threatening line
over the wicket, lovely shape into the left-hander then away off the seam. No stroke
full length, you can't touch that! Not quite Hammer-time from Amir as he seams one round a tentative outside edge
shoulders arms once more. Patience in abundance from Ireland's tail. Just taking time out of the game for now, which could be vital if they can't take wickets later today
squeezed into the covers, an easy single, then a bonus overthrow as the shy comes in from Imam. Every little helps
speared down the leg side
solidly blocked back down the pitch
wheeling away from over the wicket, pushed into the off side off the back foot
whittled off the toes, down to deep backward square leg
stunning timing off the pads! Rankin picks off the loose ball, and fizzes it clean through backward square. There's no cutting that one off!

bowled him! Angled across the left-hander, Rankin is caught in two minds, tries to leave but under-edges onto his own timbers! Abbas kicks the turf in a mixture of joy and frustration. Pakistan are one away from embarking on their run-chase
a bit of a woolly swish to launch the innings. Feet going nowhere. Careful now!
battered back past the bowler! That's the way to do it! Just back of a length, so Murtagh went for the big wind-up and slotted his slog through long-off. A few more of those will be very handy...
leaning into a drive, into the covers, but can't beat the field
round the wicket, dangled outside off stump, Kane might have been tempted to have a wipe there, but discretion remains the better part of valour
tighter line from round the wicket, a flat-footed waft, through to the keeper
pushed back onto the stumps, full face of the blade, back down the track
guided off the back foot into the off side, a bit of hesitation as they turn, but the shy from Shadab was weak and Kane makes it home
very wide and this time he is lured into a slap, but can't connect
outside off, and punched into the covers. The lead ticks up
a stand-and-deliver slash from deep in the crease. Keeps low as Kane's blade whizzes through the line

all over! Five for Abbas, who performs the sajda after shattering Kane's stumps via an inside edge. It's been a valiant effort from the bowler, and the Ireland batsmen too. And the target is a tantalising 160
full length, a hint of shape but nothing extravagant. Punched back down the pitch and into the non-striker's stumps
a pre-meditated march out to meet Murtagh's length, and an urgent clip out through the leg side. A show of intent straightaway
another gallop down the pitch! Murtagh hauls his length back in response and the cordon go up in excitement rather than expectation

edged and gone! Goodness me, this is a huge breakthrough! Murtagh refused to stray from his strengths amid all of Azhar's prancing, and just found some lovely shape on a good length, a bit of new-ball bite, a tentative prod, and a flying edge to first slip! That is how to use the conditions, and now then, Pakistan, what's your response?
a left-hander in Murtagh's sights now, more shape back into the pads, and more yelping from the cordon

flashed uppishly through point! It's four, but it's another moral victory ... drawing anxious strokes left, right and centre! A bit of width this time, but more movement to disrupt the flow of Haris' bat
through to the keeper. Good carry as you'd expect from the lanky Ranky
full length, on off stump, squirted tentatively out to point
big stride, full face of the bat, pushed down the line of the ball
beauty! Full length, descending like a comet, and biting off the pitch. Haris is lured into a poke but avoids the edge this time
on the back foot, tapped to the leg side
wider line, no stroke needed this time
full face of the bat, pushed into the off side
punched through the covers, a more measured display of ball-striking this time, leaning forward and pressing through the gap
tighter line across the left-hander, defended with a full face straight back down the pitch
stands tall on the back foot, eased out to point
over-pitched this time, and that's a lovely composed clip, all along the ground out through the leg side
through to the keeper, beating the outside edge
on the back foot, stabbed back down the pitch
fuller length, wider line, zipping off the deck and through to the keeper
leaning onto the front foot, punched into the covers

gone as well! A tentative back-foot stab into the off side, but Rankin's extra height does for Haris, who can't get over his stroke! Ed Joyce in the gully, gathers low, straight off the face of an uppish push ... and Ireland are on fire! Oh, lummie, they are checking the no-ball, and it is so tight, but it is out!
fizzed down the leg side, pace and intent ... but the line goes awry for a moment
patted out to deep point, guided well through the off side
blimey, that's a tight leave! Just outside off and it's inches from taking off stumo
fuller, at off stump, defended on the front foot
through him! Pakistan are three down. Astonishing scenes. A good length ball, hint of shape back, Shafiq plays a loose drive and the ball goes through the massive gap to take off stump
nice delivery, good length with a hint of shape away, defended down in front of four slip
played into the leg side
that's not a million miles away, nips back off the seam and takes him on the front pad
short of a length on the pads, clipped to deep square leg
that's a brute of a ball! Back of a length, straight, jumps at the batsman, squares him up and slams into the stomach
short outside off, he's onto the back foot and drives to point
now the yorker! Almost gets through, takes the toe of the bat as Babar jabs down...then it bounces back over the stumps
just loses his line, angled into the hip and nicely timed through square leg
back of a length outside off, hits the splice as he defends to cover
full at leg stump, clipped off the pads through midwicket
that's a good one, slides across outside off and pretty sure Imam played at that
full outside off, positive stride forward, driven straight of mid-off
full at off stump, defended to point and a very loud call of 'no'...there's been some iffy running in this match
another one beats the edge! Climbs from a good length, angled across the left hander, and O'Brien takes it on the rise
full and straight, giving the ball every chance to swing, pushed to mid-off
on the pads, worked to long leg
good shot, short outside off and he fully commits to going up and over backward point
responds with a very full delivery at the stumps, pushed into the covers
full at off stump, defended
full again, driven to mid-off
that's a beauty! Full delivery just outside off, starts to shape in then moves away late to beat the outside edge. Too good
edged, but short of first slip! Pitches around middle, on a good length, moves across and takes the edge but dies well in front of Stirling
manages to control it off the face of the bat this time as he plays forward, slides behind backward point
full and straight, clipped off middle stump through square
back of a length outside off, defended to cover
full outside off, left alone
angled into the pads, takes his bottom hand off the bat as he works it past short leg
a bouncer over leg stump, he ducks
good length at off stump, defended
angled across outside off, left one
gets inside the line of a short-of-a-length delivery, tucked through square leg
full outside off, shapes in, defended on the front foot. Good running
gets his line wrong, outside leg stump, on the pads and clipped very fine...he's playing nicely
good length, defended with soft hands
fuller, outside off, left alone
short of a length, knocks it down into the leg side
full at off stump, gets across the crease and defends to the off side
left alone outside off
gets forward outside off, slides off the face through third man
full at the stumps, defended on the front foot
that's sprayed way down the leg side
back on good line and length outside off, swings away, left alone
left alone outside off
very full but he's not tempted into having a drive, watches it through to the keeper
close with a direct hit! Pushed through the covers and he decides to come back for the second. Has to bring out the dive. He would probably have been safe
worked off the pads into square leg
back of a length, defended to the off side
gets onto his toes and punches off the back foot to the covers
full outside off, left alone
across his crease, takes the bat outside the line and lets it go through
short of a length outside off, gets nicely over the top of it and drives to backward point where the sub, McBrine, does well
this one is full outside off, almost rolls along the ground through to the keeper
gets this one through the field, short again, similar to the shot earlier in the over but this time the placement is perfect wide of backward point
across onto off stump and tickles this into the leg side off the inside edge
short of a length at off stump, defended to the bowler
this one comes off the edge! Squirts towards gully but doesn't reach Joyce. Full outside off, brought the drive and almost the reward
pushed back to the bowler
full outside off, left alone
good length outside off, Imam quite a way across his crease, runs off the face through backward point
nicely placed, a punchy drive off the back foot between cover and mid-off
gets this one back on the full length that has caused most problems, left alone
gets well forward on off stump and defends
angled across outside off, left alone
same spot, full outside off, considerable movement away after it pitches and scuttles through on the second bounce to Niall O'Brien
this time there's more carry, O'Brien moves across in front of first slip to take...just a sign of some uneven bounce
excellent stroke, gets a big stride forward and latches onto some width outside off with a cracking square drive
leaves this one alone outside off
pitches just outside off and swings away considerably through to the keeper
full at off stump, solidly into line
across into off stump, good stride forward, defends
a ripper to beat the outside edge! Pitches on a good length outside off and jags away, Babar may just have pulled the bat inside the line
and this one nips back, lovely bowling. Makes him play, takes a thick inside edge and bounces down past leg stump
slips this down the leg side, perhaps trying for the magic ball
short of a length outside off, defended to the off side
outside off from round the wicket, a big yawning leave to launch the afternoon session
three slips in place as Rankin aims full and straight. Blocked
flashed through the covers, good positive intent, leaning onto a fractional over-pitch with good footwork and a flowing bat
wider line, no stroke this time
on the back foot, nudged to the leg side
stoutly into line, and lovely timing down to the edge of the long-on boundary, excellent running too, forcing his partner through for the third
up on the toes, nudged into the covers, runs flowing thanks to some good brisk running and excellent gap picking
edged, and dropped! A genuine nick, at a low but catchable height, and Balbirnie at third slip gets his left hand to it, but can't close his fingers! A big miss
salt in the wounds! Shorter, wider and thumped urgently on the up and through the covers. That's the fifty stand as well. Pakistan battling back
tapped into the covers
leaning onto the front foot to block
banged in short, flashed through backward square with power and intent. A roundhouse pull, and how quickly things turn ... could have been 60 for 4 ... now 68 for 3
reaching high in delivery stride, and fired down the leg side
outside off, full length, Imam squares up on the back foot to defend
flashed through the vacant gully! That's a horribly loose shot, just flinging the bat at a length delivery, and deserved to pay the price. Instead, he pierced the gap!
left alone on a wider line
swing on a full length, Imam shoulders arms and NoB can't gather with a tumble behind the stumps
over-pitched on the toes, and clipped with calm timing out through the leg side. Bread and butter stroke
full, straight, blocked
angling onto the front foot, and blocked back down the pitch
firmly blocked back down the pitch
too short this time, just enough width, and Babar batters this one through point. Murtagh is probably tiring a touch, a rare loose one
that's the length from Murtagh! Nipping off the seam with the keeper standing up. Babar wears this one on the thumb, and shakes it in pain.
through to the keeper, left alone
tucked to the leg side, a sharp single and a direct hit from the sub fielder, McBrine, at midwicket. But he's easily home
fired down the leg side
on the pads, flicked through the leg side. Pakistan are motoring now
on the pads once more, Boyd is looking a little bereft of ideas at the moment. Surely time to test an option or two. Tyrone Kane bowled well without reward in the first innings
cracked hard off the back foot, out to deep cover
nudged off the legs to complete a less-than-probing over
angled defence out to backward point
full length, a hint of nip off the seam, forward to meet the ball and pushed to the off side
full and straight, and pushed straight back to the bowler
onto the front foot once more
nibbled off the toes, just swinging invitingly into a leg-side clip. It's all going Pakistan's way now
good ball to finish, full and swinging outside off stump, no stroke offered
width outside off, and flashed into the covers. Good signs of swing though
big swing across the left-hander, but starting too wide to tempt the batsman to respond
through to the keeper once again, width and temptation against the swinging ball
down the leg side in the end, but that's not a terrible line, starting outside leg and threatening to swing across the pads
well played Imam, read the swing well, clipped hard off the toes and brings up a maiden Test fifty on debut!
outside off, swinging once more, through to the keeper
on the toes, full and fuller, pushed back down the pitch
outside off, a big leave, gloves held high
full face, back down the pitch
striding onto the front foot, pushed out into the covers
on the back foot, punched firmly into the covers
outside off, and battered out through point. This is threatening to drift away from Ireland now
full length, a wafty drive, out into the covers
onto the front foot, a low full toss, and clubbed through the covers! This is serene now for Pakistan. The buzz has gone out of Ireland's play, ever since that Balbirnie drop, really
no stroke offered this time, through to the keeper
met on the back foot, and blocked back down the pitch
big stride down the pitch, nothing doing there
big appeal! Kane gets one to nip back off the seam and tuck Imam up as he attempts to leave alone. Umpire Illingworth reckons that's going over, and he's probably right
fired down the leg side, with good pace
pushed onto the back foot, good tight line
leg-sided once again
shorter, wider, but a slapped cut through the off side doesn't come off
chiselled off the toes, well timed and placed once again, worked out to the edge of the rope to take Pakistan ever closer
over-pitched, a bit powder-puff now from Big Boyd, and that's easily worked into the covers
outside off, keeps low as Imam leans onto the front foot
on the back foot, and worked into the covers
driven, in the air for a moment, but safely into no-man's land in the covers. Not quite covering the swing there
full length, bending away, left alone
driven compactly to mid-off
tucked off the toes to deep midwicket
tapped off the front foot to cover
right under the nose and pushed down the pitch
nips off the seam, hits the thigh pad as Babar raises his gloves out of harm's way
worked to the leg side, as Rankin comes round the wicket
round the wicket, very short, through to the keeper
down the leg side, a bit of a nothing bouncer
short and down the leg side once more, Rankin fully on the defensive now
round the wicket from the outset, wide line, no stroke
big nip off the seam but on a wide line. Left alone
through to the keeper, wide line once more
through to the keeper once more
full length and defended back down the pitch
optimistic appeal as Imam is pinned on the knee-roll! Looked as tight as anything there's been in a while, but probably going over the top ... actually, there was an inside-edge
beats the edge from round the wicket! That's more like it from Rankin, a fuller length and a bit of nip off the seam
squared up with an urgent push down the line, and a leading edge out through point. A fumble gifts the runs. Poor effort that
full face of the bat, fenced back down the line
short and wide
pulled around the corner, short and into the arm-pit
full length, and defended
outside off, through to the keeper
a crunching drive into the covers, reading the swing well and bashing his shot out to point, where Kane pounces well
wide line, big swing, no stroke
lovely strike. Big stride, on the up, meeting the width with a full face and eased into the gap
banged in short, hauled out through midwicket and Babar's fifty comes up! Tremendous resolve from this pair, they've taken a sticky situation and run away with it
outside off, angling away with the arm, no stroke
full length, appreciable swing but too wide to tempt a mistake
big inswinger, well bowled but well read too, chipped out through the leg side
round the wicket, down the leg side, Rankin oversteps. He has looked a bit baked since his first incisive spell
leg-sided again, Ireland need to keep their strike bowlers firing to the bitter end, but they've not got much gas left now
on the back foot, fenced to the off side
beautiful timing. Pushed into the gap at wide mid-on, right to the perimeter of the field. Easy pickings now
on the pads, nudged to the leg side
flicked through backward square, drawing ever closer
fuller length, drilled into the covers
round the wicket, more nip off the seam but no great threat on that wide line
tucked off the hip to midwicket
still two slips as Thompson dangles another tempter in the channel outside off
full length, defended off the back foot, straight back down the pitch
cracked hard into the covers, but a fine half-stop to cut off the runs
left alone once more
cut fiercely through point, top biffing, but too short from the toiling Murtagh
full and straight, nudged back down the pitch
that's a sharp take from O'Brien, standing up to the stumps
outside off, through to the keeper
outside off, back of a length, punched into the covers
fully forward and blocked into the off side
on the back foot, riding the steepling bounce and dropping the ball at his feet
a flashy drive and an inside-edge! So close, just hopping over the timbers as Thompson flings his hands to his head
good shape on a full length, curling towards the cordon
tapped into the covers
flipped off the toes, out through square leg
sliding down the leg side
outside off, Murtagh keeps plugging away. O'Brien gathers
swing from back of a length, no stroke this time
no stroke once again
on the back foot, thumped into the covers
full length once more, a slightly miscued drive squirts out to midwicket
left alone, outside off, nip off the seam, gathered well by the keeper

onto the front foot, pushed into the covers, and a terrible mix-up! Balbirnie does well to cut off the shot, releases quickly with a lob back to the bowler, Thompson with the gather and stretch, and Babar Azam is run out!
massive appeal! Thompson has nipped one back into the pads, and that would have been plumb but for an apparent inside-edge!
full length, late swing, drilled into the covers, and Balbirnie stretches well once again to intercept
round the wicket, on the back foot, pushed out to cover
on the back foot, standing tall in defence
round the wicket, very full length, punched to mid-on
pushed on the up to point
still three slips for the toiling Murtagh, tucked to the leg side
wristy chop through backward point. Lovely timing, and a release of a touch of the pressure in this over
half-driven, back down the pitch
well bowled, very full and lovely shape, bending towards the off stump. Blocked
tight line, angled into the off stump, blocked
width, back of a length, no stroke
attempted leave to an outswinger across the bows, but in the end well timed through backward point
that's a nice line, jagging across the left-hander with decent pace and carry
forward and tucked to the leg side
outside off, no rush to the finish for the skipper
back of a length, straightening off the deck, and Thompson oversteps to take the requirement down to 12
lovely shape! Bending in, nipping away, beating the edge. Ireland are still fighting, but it's a lost cause now
round the wicket, angled into the pads, solidly blocked with a full face of the bat
outside off, through to the keeper with late bend
left alone once more
on the back foot, right behind the line
well bowled, this one jags off the seam, lifting through to the keeper as Imam leans forward
this is a fine late rally from Kane, who has yet to take a wicket in the Test, but he bends this one past the edge at good pace, and Imam is beaten twice in a row
left alone outside off, keeps a touch low
back of a length, and thumped firmly through point to take the target into single figures!

big appeal, and nailed on the knee-roll! Thompson is rewarded for his perseverence... kept a touch low as Sarfraz shaped to pull and up goes the finger! He doesn't look best pleased, might have been sliding leg-side, but Ireland have a late reward for their efforts
tight wicket-to-wicket line. Blocked
outside off, and left alone

round the wicket, stabbed back down the pitch on the back foot
